➤ https://lnkd.in/eKi5cCce 






#executivecoaching #upskill #ai #careeradvice #professionaldevelopment #criticalthinking #leadership | Peter Fuller Tony Cruz Susan Williams

In a society obsessed with titles, let's not forget the power of character. 


Before chasing professional titles, prioritize character development. In a world dazzled by designations, remember that your integrity, empathy, and authenticity carry more weight. 

Here's how I recommend you elevate your impact:

▶ Regularly assess your values and how they guide your decisions. 
▶ Practice Empathy. Put yourself in others' shoes to enhance understanding.
▶ Foster trust by consistently being truthful and transparent.
▶ Face challenges with positivity and learn from setbacks.
▶ Engage in acts of kindness that uplift those around you & in your community.

Remember, your character is your legacy – it speaks louder than any title ever will. 

Coaching can help; let’s chat. | Follow Joshua Miller



#executivecoaching #leadership #careeradvice

In today's volatile landscape, high-performing #teams are a leader's most powerful catalyst for success. 



Are you intentionally creating an environment where teams can thrive? 

FACT: The best leaders masterfully blend trust, accountability, diversity of thought, and a unifying purpose. They foster psychological safety and empower teams to boldly innovate.

Those stuck in outdated command-and-control models will quickly become irrelevant. 

If you’re a leader, consider hiring an executive coach to amplify your ability to ignite high-performing teams.

There are a number of reasons a leader may consider hiring a leadership coach. All of the reasons are unique to each leader, but hopefully they are driven from wanting to improve from their current leadership level. There are so many coaches within this field that it can be difficult to find the right one for you. It's an investment for sure. Who do you select?, is there a top x list?, which coach will be a good match for me? I can't answer these questions for you but if you find yourself looking for a leadership coach, I highly recommend you reach out to Josh in your search.  While you can view his depth in experience, breadth of media distribution avenues, and master coaching credentials in his bio, Josh listens, draws from years of experience and uses tools from his tool bag to fit your current situation.

I have had the pleasure to work with Josh over the past year. With Josh it is a relationship. If you commit to driving areas that you want to focus on with Josh, he can give you tools for success that may feel uncomfortable at times, but eventually will feel natural. You can trust Josh to pay attention to your needs. My biggest win working with Josh has been the increased illumination of my self-awareness. recommendations.name: Susan Sheffield
recommendations.subtitle: Creative Director | Consumer-Led Brand & Product Strategy | Driving Growth Through Creativity & Team Culture
recommendations.context: Joshua was Susan's client
recommendations.description:
My wife and I hired Susan to consult and design the build-out of several rooms in our new home, and she exceeded every expectation. From our very first meeting, Susan demonstrated an exceptional ability to listen deeply to our vision while bringing her expert design perspective to elevate it in ways we hadn't imagined. Her attention to detail, thoughtful approach to space planning, and creative problem-solving transformed our ideas into a cohesive, beautiful reality.

Susan's professionalism, responsiveness, and collaborative spirit made the entire process seamless and enjoyable. She balanced aesthetics with functionality flawlessly, ensuring every design choice served both form and purpose. Her ability to communicate clearly, manage timelines, and deliver on her commitments made her an absolute pleasure to work with.

If you're looking for a designer who combines creativity, expertise, and genuine care for her clients' vision, I cannot recommend Susan highly enough. She's truly exceptional at what she does.

headline: 🚀 Driving Digital Transformation | Fintech • ERP • AI Solutions | Helping Businesses Automate, Scale & Innovate | Founder @ Vaultage LLC
about:
I help businesses modernize, automate, and scale by aligning technology with strategy. With 25+ years leading IT and transformation initiatives across the U.S., Africa, and Europe, I specialize in delivering enterprise-grade solutions that drive growth, efficiency, and innovation.

Through Vaultage LLC, the company I founded in 2016, we build:

Custom Software & Mobile Apps – tailored to unique business challenges

ERP Solutions – design, implementation, and integration for industries from automotive to pharma

Business Process Automation – simplifying workflows and boosting efficiency

AI Integration – practical applications of AI for data insights, automation, and smarter decisions

Cloud & IT Strategy – guiding seamless migrations and scalable operations

Most recently, Vaultage has been developing a next-generation fintech platform that bridges traditional banking with digital assets. Designed to support both consumers and businesses, this project demonstrates how we combine innovation with enterprise-grade compliance and security.

👉 I share insights on ERP, AI, and fintech—from strategy to real-world applications—to help leaders transform operations and grow with confidence.

headline: Founder and CEO @ Brands Essential Consultancy Group | MCIM
about:
As Founder and CEO of Brands Essential Consultancy Group (BECG) since 2010, I have been dedicated to empowering businesses worldwide to enhance their brand development and build sustainable competitive advantages. With over 15 years of experience, I work to integrate sound business strategies, global marketing approaches, and robust brand equity initiatives to drive financial growth, market expansion, and profitability for business-owned firms.  

With a focus on brand development, team building, and enhancing service processes, I collaborate with organizations to create global brands that resonate with target markets. As a Member of the Chartered Institute of Marketing (MCIM), I strive to enable companies to achieve their long-term growth objectives through strategic planning and innovative branding efforts.

experiences.title: Founder and CEO
experiences.jobDescription: Our Vision at BECG is to bring firms into the forefront of their respective industries through brand development and equity building.  Brands Essential Consultancy Group (BECG) has been working with Business owned firms from around the world to develop Global Brands that will sustain their competitive advantage in the long term.  Our work will bring together all aspects of building a brand including the foundations of developing a sound business strategy that will work globally, creating a marketing strategy that will be attractive to the target market globally, and building a strong brand that will raise the financial equity of the company in the long term whilst gaining market growth and profitability.   We are specialists in online marketing, digital marketing, social media development through a brand and marketing strategy.

headline: Founder of MOOZ: Video conferencing platform for music education
about:
Serial entrepreneur passionate about innovation and technology in education and beyond. Here's a glimpse into my journey:

2023: Founder of MOOZ, a revolutionary App transforming global music education. Think of it as a "Zoom for music education" but three times more effective, designed specifically for music and vocal lessons. With paying users in 45 countries, MOOZ is setting a new standard in online education, offering tools like real-time accompaniment, multi-camera support, and MIDI integration to make lessons immersive and productive.

2021: Founder of Musio, a CRM tailored for educational institutions, streamlining operations and enhancing learning management.

2020: Founder of Leni App, your pocket accompanist, helping musicians practice anywhere, anytime.

2016: Founder of CBI Technologies, an IT company specializing in innovative solutions for a global market.

2013: Founder of Web Friends, an IT company delivering cutting-edge web solutions.

2012: Founder of SoundCar, a car audio sales company that catered to audiophiles and automotive enthusiasts.

2009: Began my entrepreneurial journey as a freelance frontend developer, achieving a Top 3 ranking on a leading freelance platform.

I’m on a mission to revolutionize industries through technology, with MOOZ leading the charge in reshaping music education worldwide. Let's connect to explore how innovation can drive change.

experiences.title: Founder & CEO
experiences.jobDescription:
MOOZ is a true game-changer in the world of online music education, redefining the way teachers and students connect and learn. With paying clients in 80 countries, MOOZ is already making a significant impact on the market. Today, it stands as a video call platform three times more effective than any other, offering features like real-time accompaniment, multi-camera support, built-in metronome, virtual piano, and MIDI integration.

MOOZ is on a mission to cover all the needs of both teachers and students in one comprehensive platform, enabling them to teach, learn, manage, and grow without limits.

As the founder and CEO of MOOZ, I am deeply involved in crafting the company's strategy, driving fundraising efforts, and building a strong network of regional partners worldwide. Together, we are shaping the future of online music education and creating a platform where innovation meets accessibility for educators and students everywhere.

updates.postText:
Over the past weeks, I spoke with several music academy and school owners about moving seriously into online lessons.
Different countries, similar scale — and very similar pain points.

Here’s what I consistently found 👇

When you run a school with dozens (or 100+) teachers and thousands of students, online isn’t blocked by demand.
It’s blocked by operations and cost scaling.

On paper, online looks simple.

In reality:
Scheduling 50–100 teachers across time zones quickly becomes a system problem
The “basic stack” (video, scheduling, billing, support) quietly grows into thousands per month
No-shows, make-ups, and admin overhead eat 10–20% of time
Abrupt tech shifts create real technostress — especially for experienced teachers

Without phased rollout and training, burnout risk spikes fast
The surprising part?

The initial investment isn’t insane — it’s manageable.
But the execution is where most schools stall.
From what I see, this is why ~80% of schools never scale online properly.
Not because online doesn’t work —
but because it’s treated as a feature, not an operating model.

My take:
Online can be profitable and sustainable —
but only when logistics, teacher experience, and cash flow are designed together from day one. MOOZ helps with it. 

Do you agree or disagree with this from your own experience?
If you run or teach at a music school, I’d genuinely love to hear your perspective in the comments 👇

The Juilliard School cracked something most online music programs still miss. Their Extension didn’t dilute excellence — it scaled it. Here’s what music teachers and school owners should really learn from Juilliard’s success.

Why Juilliard Extension Works — and What Music Teachers Can Learn
Juilliard Extension proves that elite music education can scale — without lowering standards.

Under the leadership of John-Morgan Bush, with strong digital strategy from Oliver Barrett and operational clarity led by Dan Vesey, Juilliard built online programs that respect both rigor and accessibility.

📌 What Music Teachers Should Learn from Juilliard Extension
Whether you’re a private teacher or run an online school, the lessons are clear:

1. Don’t dilute — structure
Accessibility works when learning paths are clear and expectations are high.

2. Teach thinking, not copying
Technique without understanding doesn’t last.

3. Design for adults intentionally
Adult learners want rigor, relevance, and respect.

4. Systems protect artistry
Operations, enrollment, and communication are part of education — not separate from it.

5. Hybrid is the future
Online delivery + deep pedagogy is not a compromise. It’s an evolution.

It succeeded because it refused to abandon:
 • standards
 • depth
 • and respect for the learner
That’s the real takeaway for music teachers today.

Juilliard Extension didn’t win by going online. It won by protecting excellence — and delivering it thoughtfully.

That’s the future of music education. Full insights on my Newsletter every Friday.

This is REVOLUTION! How We at MOOZ Plan to Eliminate Latency in Online Music Lessons 

If you’ve ever tried to play music together online, you know the pain: it’s impossible to stay in sync. Even a 100 ms delay makes true collaboration impossible. That’s why all “online jams” today are really just people taking turns, not playing together.

At MOOZ, we decided to change that.
Because our platform works with digital instruments as MIDI keyboards, guitars, drums, and violins, we receive the signal in digital form, not through a microphone.

And here’s where the magic begins: we transmit that digital signal inside our system and synchronously reproduce the sound on the other side.
The result? Two people can actually play together in real time, as if sitting at the same instrument: piano-piano, guitar-piano, drums-vocal, any combo works.
Yes, vocals are trickier since the sound still goes through the mic; latency is inevitable.

But our R&D team is already exploring ways to push that boundary too.
Our goal is to build the world’s first system that lets musicians play together online with zero latency. Not a simulation, not a recording, but real-time collaboration in the digital space.

Music should connect people, not separate them by distance.
And we’re building the technology to make that happen.


#OnlineMusicLessons #RealTimeCollaboration  #MIDIJamSession  #ZeroLatencyMusic  #DigitalInstruments  #RemoteMusicTeaching  #MusicEducationTech  #PlayTogetherOnline  #VirtualJamSession  #SynchronousMusic  #MusicEdInnovation  #MusicianLife  #MusicTechStartup  #CollaborativeMusic  #MusicTeaching

MOOZ will become the largest dealer of musical instruments. The only question is — with whom will we do it? 🎹🥁🎸

Today, MOOZ is the new Zoom for musicians — a specialized video platform for music education. We are already changing the rules of the game in online lessons: one of our most useful features is support for digital pianos, and we are developing integrations with digital drums, guitars, and violins.

In 5 years, MOOZ will become the standard for online music education. Which means:
We will shape industry trends and define which software and hardware actually work for teachers and students.

We will become the voice of trust — from choosing microphones and cameras to recommending instruments.

We will grow into the main partner for instrument and accessory manufacturers — Yamaha Corporation, Casio, Roland Corporation U.S., and others.
Yamaha (Marcia Neel, Sotaro Nishida, Jeffrey Scott, John Wittmann, Tom Sumner, Masamitsu KITASE, Cecilia Yue), Casio, Roland — it’s time to think about this now.
In just a few years, we will be selling a record number of instruments and accessories, because MOOZ will become the entry point into music for millions of people.
Who will dominate online music education in the coming years? The answer is clear: those who build an ecosystem, not just a service.
MOOZ is not just technology. It is influence on how millions of people learn. And that’s exactly why we will become the largest sales channel for musical instruments in the world. 🚀

#music #sales #yamaha #roland #casio #education

publications.title: Data and the World of Today
publications.summary:
Technology is changing at a rapid pace. The demands on our businesses continue to grow and our clients’ expectations are constantly evolving. Data is the driving force behind those expectations. We are gathering more data than ever before, which means that businesses need to change and adapt.

This book was written to help entrepreneurs understand what important and pivotal technologies exist on a high level, the importance of having a data-driven company, and how data and technology can be leveraged. 

Change no longer takes years to evolve. It happens in real-time in life and business. A key to entrepreneurial success is learning to leverage that change and allow it to help you compete against anyone in your marketplace - including the large businesses and brands.

recommendations.name: Carrie Ingersoll
recommendations.subtitle: Sr. Director, Global Customer Success at Seagull
recommendations.context: Jesse worked with Carrie on the same team
recommendations.description: In looking over my own career there are few people that set the standard and baseline for what good looks like. Carrie is one of those people. Not only was she a great partner but an exceptional leader. She understands how to inspire her org even when the odds aren't great and the deck is stacked against. She finds data and good business process invaluable. During our time her org drove more bookings consistently for the company (by a long shot) than any other area within the organization. She works harder than most and also understands how to prioritize. She isn't afraid of change and will roll up her sleeves to lead by example when needed. If you are looking for one of the best AM leaders out there that can not only drive upsells & retention and also, boost culture then look no further.

recommendations.name: Chris Emerton
recommendations.subtitle: VP Sales Operations, Revenue Operations and Customer Operations
recommendations.context: Jesse worked with Chris on the same team
recommendations.description: Chris has that special gift of building great teams and keeping them motivated.  After working with Chris I now know why they say Canadians are so nice!  When it comes to Sales Operations he is a real pro, watching him partner with so many aspects of the business you can really see his experience come through. Not many Sales Ops people have carried a bag and managed sellers so he understands what a sales team really needs.

recommendations.name: Dhairya Mistry
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Manager, Sales Technologies at Qumulo | Salesforce Certified Application Architect
recommendations.context: Jesse was senior to Dhairya but didn't manage Dhairya directly
recommendations.description: I really enjoyed working with Dhairya. He is a Salesforce and internal systems architect guru. I have worked with a lot of Salesforce admins/leads and he is by the far the best. He is highly knowledgeable but, more importantly, can think outside the box. He understands that, at times, we simply need data and that the system doesn't have to be perfect. He understands what perfect looks like but values execution and iteration above it which is vital in any startup environment. What I liked most about working with him was his positive attitude and energy. We didn't always agree on how something should/could be done but I always left a meeting feeling better than when I started it. He has the makings of a leader and highly collaborative in nature. He would be an invaluable asset to any organization and would be a cultural boost to any team in a big way.

recommendations.name: Deniz C.
recommendations.subtitle: ADHD Coach at Journey ADHD Coaching | Supporting adults in sustainable ways of working and living
recommendations.context: Jesse managed Deniz directly
recommendations.description: In my time as a leader, I have had the privilege to hire and work with a few extraordinary people. Deniz is by far one of the best. She is incredibly smart, great at problem solving, teachable, and can see beyond barriers finding what's possible. When I think about the book, The Ideal Team Player, she is humble, hungry, and smart. The thing I appreciate most of all is her attitude. No matter how tough things get she is always a positive presence on the team. She is one of those people you are excited to interact with and lifts those around her up. She has all of the skillsets in the area of Comp but I would also hire her for any role in Revenue Operations side of the business. Her attention to detail, flexibility with ever changing priorities, process driven, and willingness to dig in & figure things out make her an invaluable asset to any organization. I hope we get to work together in the future. But if you are looking for an A player and a significant boost to your culture Deniz would be it!

recommendations.name: Heather Moore
recommendations.subtitle: VP of Revenue Operations & GTM Sales Enablement | Scaling PE-Backed Companies to IPO at Multi-Billion Valuations | Co-founder AI Start Up
recommendations.context: Jesse worked with Heather on the same team
recommendations.description: Heather is an A player & I highly recommend Heather. She is a visionary leader that values the intersection of data and strategy. The ability to come into a challenging situation, lead & grow a team that was vital to the company, and work within limiting budgets & guidelines was impressive. She values setting clear strategy and objectives along with defining & measuring what success looks like before even implementing. Her positive attitude, forward looking, and collaborative nature make her an invaluable asset to a company. She brings fresh perspectives and has a broad knowledge of methods, processes, and technologies that can take a Sales organization to the next level.

recommendations.name: Paige Johnson
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Marketing Director - Global Partner Ecosystem - Three Time Unicorn Partnerships Leader, Google Cloud Partner Sales All-Star, AWS Alum
recommendations.context: Jesse worked with Paige on the same team
recommendations.description: When looking for a hardworking, enjoyable, and easy person to work with Paige is one of the people that comes to mind. She is data driven and a strategic visionary. She brings positive energy and passion to each interaction. She is excellent at communication and leadership. I have enjoyed my time working together with her at Qumulo.

headline: Founder| AI Growth Strategy | Personal Branding | Fortune 500 & Startups Business Automation & Global Transformation | Architect of AI-Native Leadership & Next-Gen Transformation
jobTitle: Growth Advisor | AI Strategy & Business Transformation
about:
I don’t help businesses play small—and neither should you.
The Growth Partner for Businesses, Founders and Leaders Who Don’t Settle.
Helping Founders & Visionaries Turn Bold Ideas Into Scalable, Profitable Realities.
At the intersection of business strategy, market disruption, and global growth, I’ve contributed to bold initiatives that span from fast-moving startups to industry-leading ecosystems. Along the way, I’ve helped shape products people love—and strategies that scale sustainably.
But beyond metrics and milestones…
I’m here for the humans behind the hustle.

What Drives Me:
— Seeing people and ideas evolve into their best versions
— Turning vision into momentum—and momentum into results
— Building smart, purpose-driven growth (without burnout)

I’m also driven by a simple yet powerful belief: emerging technologies—when applied with purpose—can transform industries and improve lives. That’s the kind of innovation worth building.

How I Can Help You Create Your Next Big Leap:

Brand Partnerships & Influencer Collaborations

I support innovative start-ups, established brands, and individual creators through meaningful collaborations.
I partner with forward-thinking people and projects—including but not limited to tech companies, AI, automation, sustainability, education, and productivity—that align with my audience and values.

If your product, service, or idea helps people work smarter, simplify daily life, inspire creativity, or scale their vision, I welcome opportunities for sponsored content, product launches, influencer campaigns, and long-term partnerships.
Let’s create campaigns that deliver real value to individuals, communities, and organizations—and measurable impact for your brand or project.

📩 For collaborations or sponsorship inquiries, please DM me here on LinkedIn.

I also help with:

— LinkedIn Personal Brand Building (That Gets You Seen)
— Startup & Scale-Up Mentoring 
— Tech Sector Advisory
— Founder Mindset & Leadership Coaching
— Life Coaching for High-Achievers

Whether you’re building a product, a brand, or a legacy— I’m here to help you go further and faster with clarity, conviction, and confidence.

📩 DM me if you’re done waiting for “someday”—and ready to make it happen now.

Thanks for reading up until here. You are amazing! ❤️

experiences.title: Growth Advisor | AI Strategy & Business Transformation
experiences.jobDescription:
10Phase is the world’s first AI-orchestrated service automation platform for industrial maintenance, developing a proprietary framework for autonomous asset-to-action decision-making. 
We leverage machine intelligence and a multi-layer AI agent architecture to transform maintenance operations. 
10Phase is positioning itself as a category-defining company shaping the future of industrial automation empowering industries to reduce downtime, increase efficiency, and unlock new levels of operational resilience.

experiences.title: Co-Founder I CMO
experiences.jobDescription:
State-of-the-art end-to-end solution for the farm task management and delivery monitoring, by addressing simplicity, robustness and scalability.
We are proud of offering the next generation of battery-operated, pre-configured and hassle-free solutions to thousands of farms across the globe.
SUSTAINABILITY, A CHALLENGE FOR ALL
By 2050 world population will reach to 10billion, which means more demand for food.
To meet this demand, and other challenges, like a change of taste, climate change, and soil erosion we either need more land and water to produce more or need up to a 70% increase in efficiency.



This is significant and there is no choice rather than taking advantage of emerging technologies to reduce water usage, increase the yield and enhance producibility and predictability. But the challenge is, there are very limited reliable options in the market, farmers can trust and use.

Cost of ownership, the complexity of implementation, poor connectivity, lack of integratability, and scalability, are the main reasons to stop farmers to rely on the internet of things and benefit from it.



DIFFERENTIATOR, THAT CHANGES THE GAME
Backed by more than 20 years of experience in the design and manufacturing of monitoring solutions, FarmTasker is the pioneer solution provider for water management, delivery management, and asset performance monitoring based on LPWAN technologies, specifically designed for agriculture and farming applications.

experiences.title: Chief Operating Officer

Ellenex is, a leading Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) device manufacturer and a pioneer engineering and technology company forging new ground in the industrial internet of things (IIoT) space. The company designs and manufactures low power sensors, the operating system and software platform to address challenges in industrial asset monitoring in remote areas. Ellenex manufactures application-centric, cost-Effective, battery Operated Industrial IoT Solutions, Pressure, Level and Temperature Sensors for 
• Water and Waste Water
• Agriculture and Farming
• Smart Buildings and HVAC
• Process Industry
• Transport and Logistics
• Food and Beverage

• Mining and Construction
Ellenex believes industrial IoT solutions need to be modular, integrable, and application-centric to make them scalable and profitable for clients. Therefore, modularity and integrability are our philosophy and are the key differentiators.

updates.postText:
The “Invisible” Trap on LinkedIn 🕸️
You’re posting daily. You’re sharing your expertise. You’re hitting “Publish” with high hopes…
…and then? Silence. 🦗
No likes. No leads. No new opportunities. It’s not that your work isn't valuable—it’s that your story isn't being told the right way.
The difference between a post that gets ignored and one that goes viral isn’t luck. It’s strategy. 📈
I help CEOs, Founders and busy professionals go viral on LinkedIn.
Rewrite your story to capture attention in seconds. ✍️
Sharpen your voice to build authority. 🎤
Engineer viral content that turns views into leads. 💰
Stop shouting into the void. It’s time to make your brand visible.
Ready for your brand makeover? 
📩 DM me "VIRAL" and let’s get to work!
#PersonalBranding #LinkedInGrowth #ContentStrategy #ViralMarketing #EmmaShad

Attention Is Now Algorithmic Reputation
Executives with 20+ years of experience are getting zero visibility online…
 while small creators are pulling 200K impressions overnight.
Not because they’re “better.”
 But because the algorithm now rewards:
 ⚡ micro-interaction velocity
 🧠 narrative clarity
 🤖 AI-assisted content timing
 🎯 audience intent signals
Your digital presence is no longer a “nice to have.”
 It’s how the market decides who matters.
In this month’s article, I unpack:
 • why traditional credibility stopped converting
 • the invisible factors feeding the algorithm
 • the new rules of digital reputation
 • and what leaders must adjust immediately
Your experience still matters —
 it just needs to be translated into this new system.
Full breakdown here. 👇

2026 AI Expectations: 7 Seismic Shifts Every Leader Must Prepare for Now
2025 was the year AI stopped being “new.”
2026 will be the year it becomes the invisible backbone of markets, governance, and personal identity.
Not a tool.
Not a department.
The substrate of how the world works.
I’ve just released my deep-dive newsletter breaking down the seven tectonic shifts already in motion:
- Agentic AI as the default interface – strategy becomes continuous code.
- Digital supply chains turn liquid – planning cycles die.
- Regulation-as-code – law starts enforcing itself.
- Capital rewards learning velocity – intelligence gain becomes the new balance sheet.
- Scarcity moves to meaning & identity – your story is your moat.
- AI-native products redefine industries – the product is the enterprise.
- Human leadership enters a new age – meaning and trust become strategic assets.
👇 Read the full analysis here: 
This isn’t a trend report.
 It’s a blueprint for the next decade of leadership.
If you lead, build, invest, or advise, this is your map for 2026 and beyond.
🔹 Which of these seven shifts will disrupt your world first?
🔹 What’s the single biggest opportunity—or risk—you see?
Drop your perspective below, share this with your team, and let’s shape the AI-native future together.
Emma Shad
Founder | AI Growth Strategy | Fortune 500 & Startups | Architect of AI-Native Leadership & Next-Gen Transformation

AI Alone Won’t Fuel Your Growth.
Markets are overflowing with AI tools and automation promises.
Yet most companies remain stuck.
why? 👇 
 Ask yourself: Are you building a business—or a legacy?
💡 Comment with one bold move you’re making this year.
 👉 Subscribe for more AI, leadership, and growth insights: https://lnkd.in/gCV3_Raw

headline: Technologist, Author, and Founder of BrightRay Publishing
about:
Scott Turman is an American technologist, author, and entrepreneur. He is the founder and CEO of BrightRay Publishing, a company that provides writing and publishing services for industry leaders. He is the host of the podcast Entrepreneurs, Executives, and Eccentrics.

Turman has authored or co-authored several books on business and technology, including How to Build Your Brand with a Book: Establishing Yourself as a Published Expert and How to Build Your Brand with a Book.

Prior to founding BrightRay, Turman worked as a software engineer and technologist, designing cryptographic systems for organizations including NASA, the U.S. Department of Defense, and Disney. He is based in Orlando, Florida.

experiences.title: CEO
experiences.jobDescription:
BrightRay Publishing is an American company that provides writing and publishing services for entrepreneurs, C-level executives, celebrities, and other public figures.

A well-crafted personal brand doesn’t just happen on its own. Utilizing your book to further establish your narrative, shape and build your credibility, publicize your accomplishments and promote your specific expertise will bolster your position in your field as well as the public’s eye.  Our job is to work with you to make that happen.

Think of us as your personal writing team. No typing necessary!

experiences.title: CEO and Principal Software Engineer
experiences.jobDescription: C# | Angular | AWS | Azure

experiences.title: C# | Angular Team Lead and .Net Architect
experiences.jobDescription:
•	Designed and developed work flow systems to register and track loans which ran their mortgage business supporting branches in 22 states.
•	Systems were built in C#, ASP.NET, MVC 4, Web API, SQL Server 2008-2012, JQuery, Knockout, Windows Services, WCF, Ajax, Console Applications, Plain Old Web Services and SubSonic.
•	Built large SSIS packages with Business Intelligence Development Studio that pulled in data from SFTP, web services and bulk data loads to facilitate reporting and user dashboards.
•	The web application drove the entire loan process allowing for all aspects to be worked on by the right employees at the right time which allowed the owner to run a lean and efficient company
•	Constantly developed new processes, rebuilt systems in .NET and C#, and directed new development
•	Communicated effectively with separate departments to find problems and develop solutions

experiences.title: Developer/DBA
experiences.jobDescription: My time at Hilton was spent working on a multi-year web application that ran every aspect of HGV’s business. My job title was DBA but I built several C# ASP.NET, Windows Services, SSIS packages and Console applications to automate many of their billing solutions and automated reporting applications. My SQL Server DBA responsibilities included database development/design and all database deployments including SQL deltas and deployment scripts.

experiences.title: Software Developer
experiences.jobDescription: NCI DOD Contractor - I built several apps that support the day-to-day base operations for the Program Executive Office for Simulation, Training and Instrumentation or PEOSTRI for short. I worked closely with the military support customer to build very secure and easily extended web apps based primarily on a data layer generator that I built for the base. This code generator interrogates SQL Servers SYSTEM tables and builds the SQL for all CRUD functionality in C#. It then generates all of the data entities and data access code (In Enterprise Library). Many of our projects timelines where cut in half as a result of our data layer generator. Most work has been built in Asp.Net 2.0 and recently in Framework 3.0. I have worked on projects that utilize SharePoint Portal Services 2003 via its Sharpoint API and web services. We have also begun using guidance packages for the web service factory design pattern. I received an award from the US Army for my work.

experiences.title: Software Developer
experiences.jobDescription: My work at Disney included the development of web service interfaces for old mainframe systems and several ASP.net projects in support of a Disney's Magical Express(DME). I also worked on Disney’s reservations systems for both their hotels and cruise lines. The technologies that I used where SQL Server 2000 and almost every facet of the .NET platform except remoting. This includes Asp.net, C#, console apps, Windows Services, web services, SOAP Services, REST Services, remote data manipulation and transmission of data to unrelated platforms.

experiences.companyName: NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration
experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.jobDescription: At the Kennedy Space Center I worked with every technology that Visual Studio 2003 had to offer. My primary focus was on an ASP.NET web application that maintained NASA’s employee data warehouse. Ours apps used data from sources that came from many technologies (DB2, Oracle, SQL Server, assorted flat files over FTP). The databases spanned many security boundaries including the United States Air Force and base operations. I utilized encrypted web services, DTS packages, console applications and several data entry screens to update the centralized employee databases. We designed a workflow engine to accomplish many of the multi step processes that NASA requires. This app powered a web application that tracks all of NASA’s projects and employee assets. The architecture is based on a standard multi tier design pattern where data objects are passed through DACL, business layer, façade, and presentation layers.

experiences.title: Software Engineer - Consultant
experiences.jobDescription: I worked on a system called lawmaker 2.0 at the Florida House of Representatives. The system tracks the entire law making process. It follows the bill making process from drafting a bill to making the bill a law. Lawmaker is designed in an assortment of C# desktop and C# ASP.NET applications. Most of my work was in ASP.NET.  I also standardized many of the INTEROP JavaScript helper classes.

experiences.title: Developer
experiences.jobDescription: At InCharge I was responsible for the development of a high volume intranet/internet app. The application was constructed for a debt management company that needed the ability to support well over 70,000 clients. This included a call center app and an online internet application that helped customers services their accounts. The app was started in BETA 1 version of .NET. We actually had production code running in BETA 2. My time a Transtegrity allowed me to become very proficient with C# / ASP.NET, data cryptography, ADO.NET, web services, and XML. The majority of the application was programmed as a web application. I also did some desktop and console applications. We used Visual SourceSafe to help deal with release issues as well as contiguous programming campaigns. We also used Rational’s ClearQuest for defect tracking. The back end was all done with SQL Server 2000. This position helped me extend my working knowledge of Transact SQL and DTS Services.

experiences.title: Developer
experiences.jobDescription: Design, develop, implement and maintain Financial, Insurance and banking software in Visual Basic 5.0 6.0, Access 95/97 and SQL 6.5. This ranged from bank ACH uploads and downloads to financial trading and modeling tools for the hedge fund. I was also responsible for the supporting documentation. My skills set includes DAO, RDO, ADO, VBA, ANSI SQL, OLEDB, Access SQL, Access table development and reporting, Oracle SQL, Client-Server VB programming.

headline: I help founder-led businesses scale execution and reclaim time by pairing them with rockstar Executive Assistants (EAs) guided by smart systems. No over explaining or micromanagement.
about:
🔴 Executive Assistants That (Actually) Work 🔴 We provide rockstar EAs that are hand-picked, battle-tested, and laser-focused on your goals. Smart AI tools keep them synced with your processes, but the real magic is their talent and attitude. 

⭐  The result? ⭐  - More done, in less time, with no over explaining or micromanagement needed.

How It Works:
- #1 - We recruit & vet top tier EAs matched to your business.
- #2 - We immerse them in your workflows, tools, and brand voice. 
- #3 - We provide coaching and use AI tools to keep performance at 10/10. 

You can handoff tasks in < 5 minutes with no SOPs - our AI tools help guide the EA. 

Goodbye classic EA headaches:

- ❌  No endless questions, your EA anticipates needs
- ❌  No hit or miss quality issues, we screen and coach rigorously
- ❌  No more constant turnover - our EAs stay for the long term.

✅ [Watch Demo Video] - See how it works at HelpFlow.com

experiences.title: Founder & CEO
experiences.jobDescription:
HelpFlow has revolutionized the Virtual Assistant industry. What sets us apart from traditional VA agencies with huge markups and minimal training / management support is our proprietary AI driven approach (plus 2 decades of experience hiring 1,000+ virtual assistants). 

How It Works: 
- #1 - We hire a rockstar human virtual assistant for you.
- #2 - We train our GuideLayer AI on your business (processes, tools, etc.).
- #3 - GuideLayer AI guides the work of the VA - step by step guidance, Q&A, etc. 
- #4 - You can assign any task or process in < 5 minutes - just speak with GuideLayer AI.

As a result, you get more done, in less time, with no management hassles. See the [DEMO] at HelpFlow.com.

We have supported a wide range of brands through our marketing agency partners, including the world’s largest computer manufacturer, a leader of the pet food supplies and services market, and more.

about: The future of business isn't found in a spreadsheet—it's built in the space between human empathy and technological efficiency.With a Master’s from Stanford University and a career spanning the forefront of human capital, I’ve seen how traditional leadership often fails the modern workforce. My mission is to bridge that gap.I’m not just a recruitment specialist; I’m a champion for Human-First Growth. Whether I’m advising the team at Workleap, investing in the next generation of SaaS, or speaking to a global audience of 113,000+, I focus on one thing: building cultures where people don’t just work—they thrive.    My work is driven by the belief that the most successful companies of the next decade won't be the ones with the best algorithms, but the ones with the deepest human connections.Core Areas of Impact:The Future of Work: Scaling resilience in a decentralized world.Ethical AI & Leadership: Integrating technology without losing the human element.Investor Mindset: Backing tools that solve real human problems.    Let’s lead the change, not just follow the trends.

updates.postText:
The Power of Respect: An excerpt from my life

This morning, I saw a post banner that reminded me of an experience that shaped my understanding of leadership, and I wanted to share it here.

During my time as an HR leader at Amazon, I formed a simple but meaningful relationship with Maria, a janitor whose warm smile and daily “Good morning” often made my day. Though not a permanent staff member, I always made it a point to acknowledge her, knowing that everyone deserves respect, regardless of their role.

One day, after weeks of struggling to fill a critical leadership position, Maria noticed my fatigue and asked how I was. I shared my challenge in hiring the right leader. To my surprise, she mentioned knowing someone who could help. Initially unsure, I sent her the job details. Maria passed them to her son, who forwarded them to a former colleague. This led to a reference that helped us find the perfect candidate.

This experience taught me that respect is not about treating someone higher or lower, but treating everyone the same. In doing so, you open doors to unexpected opportunities and build lasting, meaningful connections.


#Leadership #RespectInTheWorkplace #HR #Recruiting #AmazonExperience

headline: Advisor & Coach to Inclusion Leaders | Turning Inclusion into Growth, Efficiency & Shareholder Value | Chairman, CDO PowerCircle | Speaker | Host, ERG PowerTalk
jobTitle: CEO & Executive Coach for inclusion Leaders
addressWithCountry: New York City Metropolitan Area, United States
about:
I help inclusion leaders transform their practices into measurable business impact engines.

As a former line executive with multimillion-dollar P&L responsibility, I know firsthand that inclusion isn’t just a value—it’s a growth strategy. Years ago, I led inclusion across a 65,000-employee enterprise and helped unlock hundreds of millions in revenue, reduce costs, and elevate culture simultaneously.

Today, through my coaching and development programs for inclusion leaders, I equip executives to:

- Prove ROI of DEI by connecting initiatives directly to financial outcomes.
- Secure greater investment by winning C-suite confidence with evidence, not anecdotes.
- Expand influence by positioning inclusion as a driver of growth, efficiency, and shareholder value.
- Build lasting strategies that protect against the hidden “exclusion tax” silently draining profits.

I am also Chairman of the CDO PowerCircle, host of the award-winning ERG PowerTalk® podcast, and a trusted advisor to executives from companies that collectively generate nearly $1 trillion in revenue. Across all these platforms, my mission is consistent: helping leaders replace compliance-driven inclusion with strategic inclusion that fuels enterprise performance.

If you’re a CDO, inclusion leader, or executive sponsor who wants to go beyond checking boxes to drive measurable results, let’s talk. I offer a free, no-strings-attached Opportunity Scan to help you uncover where exclusion is costing your company—and where inclusion can unlock new growth.

experiences.title: CEO & Executive Coach for inclusion Leaders
experiences.jobDescription:
I help DEI leaders move beyond compliance-driven initiatives to build inclusion strategies that deliver measurable business impact.

Through my coaching and development program, I partner with Chief Diversity Officers, DEI executives, and senior inclusion leaders to:

- Prove ROI by linking DEI to revenue growth, cost reduction, and efficiency.
- Secure greater investment by building financial cases executives can’t ignore.
- Expand influence by positioning inclusion as a business strategy, not just a social imperative.
- Develop future-ready strategies that cut the hidden “exclusion tax” draining profits.

Clients & impact: Leaders I work with represent companies that collectively generate nearly $1 trillion in revenue and employ over 1 million people. Together, we’ve uncovered hidden profit drains worth tens to hundreds of millions of dollars—and built strategies to reverse them.

My company also powers:

CDO PowerCircle – An exclusive peer community for CDOs at major enterprises.

ERG PowerTalk® Podcast & Academy – Equipping BRG/ERG leaders and sponsors to deliver business impact.

Supercharge Workshops – Customized learning experiences for accelerating leadership growth.

These platforms extend the reach of my coaching and ensure DEI leaders at all levels—from ERG leaders to CDOs—have access to tools that turn inclusion into a force multiplier for business performance.

experiences.companyName: ERG PowerTalk owned by Joseph Santana, LLC
experiences.title: Founder and Host of the ERG PowerTalk Podcast & Chairman of the ERG PowerTalk Virtual Academy
experiences.jobDescription:
Employee operated networks are an essential partner in the current and future success of all 21st-century companies. From CEO’s through CHROs and CDOs, everyone agrees that these groups will continue to play a critical role in their organizational success. From breeding new leaders through making organizations more agile through helping co-create the future structure of the company, ERGs and BRGs will always play an important role. 

The effectiveness of these networks, in turn, is based to a great degree on the skills and passions of their leadership teams. Unfortunately, up until recently, only a few organizations had the budgets to send a few of their ERG leaders to training conferences or to pay someone to come to their company and deliver professional development training to these network leaders. That is until now with ERG PowerTalk. ERG PowerTalk makes employee group leadership development and inspiration available to all, affordable by all, and accessible by all at any time and any place through their mobile devices. In addition to this, forward-thinking organizations that sponsor the podcast also get access to a live 6 part learning series led by top trainer/facilitators for all their ERG/BRG leaders that's valued in the tens of thousands of dollars, freely included with their sponsorship.

To learn more about this top 5-star rated podcast with thousands of listeners in five English speaking countries, and get more free #ERG / #BRG leadership support resources visit http://ergpowertalk.com

updates.postText:
Inclusion Leaders: You Can’t Win by Playing Defense

Inclusion leaders, this image says what many of you are living right now.
Blocking.

Absorbing blows.

Protecting what is left of your practice.

Meanwhile, budgets continue to shrink, influence erodes, and decisions get made without you.

Defense alone never wins a fight.

Here is a concise blueprint for winning in this environment:

1.    Stop framing inclusion as protection. Executives fund offense, not shields. Tie your work directly to growth, risk reduction, productivity, and market opportunity.

2.    Move from values to value creation. Translate inclusion into revenue lift, faster innovation, better customer access, and operational advantage.

3.    Engage power centers, not just allies. Finance, operations, sales, and strategy decide what survives. Build relevance where decisions are made.

4.    Choose your punches deliberately. Focus on fewer, high impact initiatives that can show results within 60 to 90 days.

5.    Fight forward, not reactively. Set the agenda. Lead with a business case. Force the conversation onto outcomes you can defend.

This moment does not call for retreat, silence, or going along to get along.

It calls for taking charge with a disciplined offense.

If you want practical, business-first strategies for winning this fight and staying relevant as an inclusion leader, subscribe to The Bizclusionist Weekly on Substack. https://lnkd.in/eyz8JDK8

No platitudes.

No theater.

Just strategies for leaders who intend to win.

#Bizclusionist #BusinessFirstInclusion #LeadershipStrategy #EnterpriseValue #FutureOfWork
Subscribe to my weekly newsletter for practical tips, insights, and news on aligning inclusion efforts with business goals and staying ahead of key developments.

updates.postText: Let’s be blunt: too many companies have been squandering one of their most valuable strategic assets—ERGs—on “small potatoes” efforts like heritage month posters, lunch-and-learns, and feel-good volunteering. Meanwhile, competitors who know better are quietly activating these communities to drive business growth, spark innovation, expand markets, and boost performance. And they’re seeing real, measurable returns. If your ERGs are mostly about virtual signaling or culture entertainment, consider this your wake-up call—and a warning. ERGs Were Never Meant to Be Decorative Despite popular belief, ERGs were never designed as “nice-to-haves.” They originated to solve costly workplace and marketplace problems by tapping into the lived experiences, insights, and networks of diverse employees to create a competitive business advantage. Somewhere along the way, this powerful purpose got diluted. ERGs became glorified party planners or culture clubs—used to make a good impression without driving substantive organizational change. Now, with DEI efforts under fire, critics say, “These groups don’t add business value.” And, I'm afraid to say they’re not entirely wrong, but only because many companies have never given ERGs the chance to prove themselves and produce real business results. What the Best Companies Are Doing Differently Leading companies don’t wait to justify ERGs—they activate them as strategic partners. They align ERGs with enterprise-wide business goals, equip ERG leaders with strategic support, and use data to track contributions to innovation, retention, customer engagement, and market intelligence. Consider the company that used its ERGs to test a new product idea—boosting market share in an underserved segment. Or the global firm that co-created a leadership pathway with ERGs cutting first-year turnover by 23%, saving tens to hundreds of millions in a 10,000-employee company. Or the tech company that reengineered onboarding with ERGs and saw engagement scores rise 15% among new hires. These results didn’t happen by accident. They happened because these companies stopped treating ERGs as culture accessories and started investing in them as business drivers. What is the difference between these success stories and companies stuck in virtue-signaling mode? The answer is “How leaders position, direct, and support their ERGs.” You’re Either Building Leverage—or Losing It Your competitors are waking up to the power of ERGs as strategic assets. Will you? If your ERGs are still relegated to holiday potlucks and cultural programs, you’re not just missing opportunities—you’re falling behind. Leadership today is about outcomes: cost savings, innovation, revenue generation, and market relevance—not optics. And if you fail to demonstrate how ERGs drive those outcomes, someone in your boardroom will eventually ask, “Why are we doing this at all?” In today’s divided climate, political correctness alone no longer buys goodwill or strategic advantage. If ERGs only make your company look “woke,” their value will be questioned—and funding cut. ERGs Are Ready to Step Up—Are You Ready to Lead Them? Most ERG leaders want to do more. They want to move beyond “celebration squads” to become strategic, business-impact-driving teams. They just need permission, clear guidance, and support from leadership to make that shift. Give them that—and watch what’s possible. What You’ll Regret Not Doing Imagine this: six months from now, a competitor leverages their ERGs to co-create a new go-to-market strategy, saving $5 million in R&D and launching eight months ahead of you. Their CDO, once buried in HR, now reports directly to the CEO. Meanwhile, you scramble to defend your shrinking DEI and ERG budget with slides full of Heritage Month photos and pizza receipts. That’s the FOMO moment you want to avoid. In my audits, I routinely find $91 million to $183 million in unrealized profit opportunities—losses any inclusion leader with properly focused ERGS can help fix. It’s Time to Act Stop squandering your ERGs on small efforts. Invest in their strategic transformation. Download my white paper, “ERGs as Strategic Assets,” to learn how to: Reposition ERGs for measurable impact Align ERG goals with enterprise priorities Support ERG leaders as business contributors, not just community organizers See examples of companies already doing this successfully Get it now at https://joesantana.gumroad.com/l/xtfrb If you have more questions about how to accelerate your business-impacting ERG efforts, drop me a note. I’m happy to chat. Currently, you may find yourself overwhelmed navigating a world where every word and gesture is scrutinized. But the biggest risk for you isn’t political backlash—it’s being sidelined as an outdated “nice-to-have” initiative that no longer offers clear value. Don’t let that happen on your watch. You have powerful assets ready to demonstrate real business impact. It’s time to put them to work. Think of it like musical chairs: the music’s playing, chairs are being removed, and when the music stops, some will have better seats, some worse, and some none at all. However, unlike musical chairs, your outcome is not determined by fate. It’s really up to you. So, don’t be too busy to act now.

publications.title: The New DEI and ERG Frontier
publications.summary:
Will your DEI and ERG efforts decline or thrive in the next year and beyond?

There is a new frontier out there facing DEI and ERG leaders? It's full of uncertainties. It has metaverses, robots, AI, pandemics, a new workforce, and the complete re-making of the workplace. Will your DEI and ERG efforts become more critical or less important in this emerging world of constant change? While no one can predict the future, the good news is we can prepare to win in it no matter how it turns out.

In this book, author, Chairman of the CDO PowerCircle, and creator and host of the award-winning podcast ERG PowerTalk Joseph Santana shows you exactly how your DEI and ERG efforts can rise and thrive in this new world of constant disruption. The book results from four years of research into leading publications on the emerging workforce, workplace, and marketplace, pulse surveys, and hundreds of hours of interviews with CEOs, CDOs, ERG leaders, data scientists, and futurists.

It starts with a look at the history of our ERG practices and their leaders that produced our modern groups. From there, it goes on to give you a glimpse at an incredible future full of faster, more impactful, and sharper disruptions, and one skill you need to master to avoid pitfalls and pounce on opportunities. Next, the book gives you specific practices and tips you can use right away to begin winning in our new disruptive normal.

Filled with stories that sound like they come from a science fiction novel, coupled with practical advice, this book combines future foresight, humor, and practical advice to produce the DEI and ERG leader's most valuable companion into the uncertain future.

Click this link to pre-order an eBook, print, or audio version of this book

I have had the pleasure of working with Joe in his role as Senior Director of Diversity for Siemens Corporation, where he was streamlining and standardizing the then separate D&I activities of the various Siemens companies operating across the USA.  

In my role as Vice Chair and later Chair of the Siemens Corporation Diversity & Inclusion Council, Joe proved to be an invaluable resource to our Employee Resource Group (ERG) leaders.  In particular, the Council had secured the opportunity for our ERG Co-Chairs to present to the C.E.O. and his executive team on their on-going operations and successes and challenges they faced.  Joe graciously offered to prepare the Co-Chairs for these presentations.  He assisted the Co Chairs of three of our ERGs to give very professional and polished presentations to this executive audience.  

Not only were the presentations themselves a success, but he instilled confidence in the ERG Co-Chairs, which has benefitted them in their regular jobs as well.  If you can present to the C.E.O. and executive team of a multibillion dollar conglomerate, you have the confidence to present to anyone.  These presentations would not have been as successful without Joe’s dedicated support to the ERG Co-Chairs.

Whether he’s delivering executive briefings, analyzing geopolitical threats, or supporting public safety efforts, he consistently demonstrates the strategic mindset, professionalism, and interpersonal skills that set future leaders apart.

If you’re looking for someone who can navigate uncertainty, communicate with impact, and deliver strategic value from day one, Steven is someone to watch—and someone well worth bringing onto your team.
