recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Mike on the same team
recommendations.description: Mike is a leader who with a few words and questions can cut though an avalanche of ideas and bring solutions into sharp focus. He has an uncanny ability for stepping into the discussion at the right moment and then providing the quiet space needed by others to formulate and express their ideas. That combined with a strong sense of caring about the success of others makes him a great Vistage Chair.

recommendations.name: Bruce McKay
recommendations.subtitle: TEAM FOX MEMBER IN THE BATTLE AGAINST PARKINSON'S
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Bruce on the same team
recommendations.description: Bruce is the embodiment of the key traits that one wants in their executive coach. In addition to a broad base of knowledge acquired through personal experience and an obvious dedication to personal life-long learning, he has an exquisite combination of perception and curiosity that produces questions that expand thinking, knowledge and actionable options. If you are looking for someone to help you make a way toward addressing challenges, seizing opportunities and moving to a higher-level of fulfillment and performance, I highly recommend Bruce McKay for your coach.

recommendations.name: Sujith Bhatia
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Vice-President - Head of Digital Grid, Americas
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Sujith but on different teams
recommendations.description: I had the distinct pleasure of working with Sujith Bhatia during his two year term as Chairman of the Siemens Energy Sector Diversity Council.  I found him to be a huge asset to me as a leader in our efforts to drive Siemens to the front of the pack in terms of competitiveness in securing and leveraging talent across all dimensions of diversity.  During his term, among other accomplishment the Siemens Energy team successfully expanded their diversity and inclusion efforts beyond the Orlando Florida campus into the highly challenging and rapidly growing production center located in Charlotte North Carolina.  The huge efforts and contributions of Sujith leadership and his teammates during this time also gained external recognition resulting in the earning of two Top Diversity Council Awards from the Association of Diversity Councils’ with a ranking in the top ten in 2011. I believe in great part this success at the Siemens Energy sector council was made possible by Sujith’s ability as a leader to understand opportunities and challenges from both a big picture and detail level and to work effectively with a team to come up with solutions that produced results.

recommendations.name: Ron Subramanian
recommendations.subtitle: Transfer Pricing Manager at Siemens Healthineers
recommendations.context: Joseph was senior to Ron but didn't manage Ron directly
recommendations.description: I’ve had the pleasure of working with Ron Subramanian through his various roles relative to diversity and inclusion at Siemens, which include co-Chairing an employee network at the Siemens Corp campus, followed by his role as Diversity Council Liaison to all the employee resource groups on the campus, through Vice Chair of the Siemens Corporate Diversity Council and now most recently Chair of the Siemens Corporate Diversity Council. I am not surprised at his steady increase in scope and responsibility. In each of these roles, Ron has shown himself to be highly engaged and a successful contributor as both participant and leader. For example, in 2011 as Vice Chair of the Diversity Council he was one of the key architects behind the planning and execution of a very successful Diversity Day that resulted in the emergence of new employee resources groups, an increased awareness of diversity across the entire campus workforce and heightened visibility for all of the previously existing employee networks. In my opinion, Ron is a natural leader with a great deal of passion and drive who is always learning, developing and then investing his growing skills in everything he pursues.

recommendations.name: Nadia V. Gil
recommendations.subtitle: Chief Strategy M&A / Corp Dev / Post Merger Integrations and Operations Officer | AI, Data Centers, Cybersecurity & Cloud Innovator | Early Seed Investor
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Nadia V. but on different teams
recommendations.description: I first came into contact with Nadia back in 2009 when she was a member of the Siemens Healthcare Sector’s national Hispanic employee network, Amig@s. In light of her energy, dedication, creative thinking and passion for helping others, I was not surprised that she became the groups National President in 2010. Nadia is one of those rare people that combine professionalism and commitment to all of her work and team related pursuits with a genuine interest in sharing ideas with others. For example, in addition to volunteering from her busy schedule to lead her National network and her contributions during monthly calls with the leaders of other networks across the company, Nadia also founded a Linkedin Group on behalf of Amig@s for all of the company’s employees. To date, she still remains one the most frequent posters to this group, which stands as a testimony to her desire to help and support her colleagues.  I personally consider Nadia a huge asset to our company’s diversity efforts and I believe she will continue through out her career to drive increasing value to her team, colleagues and the company in ways that transcend her day job duties!

recommendations.name: Jessica Hodor
recommendations.subtitle: Product & Project Manager | Driving Clarity and Results in Unstructured Environments | Agile | PROSCI Certified | Human-Centered Design Thinker
recommendations.context: Joseph was senior to Jessica but didn't manage Jessica directly
recommendations.description: I had the pleasure of meeting and working with Jessica six years ago when I called a meeting of all the procurement professionals across our Sectors and Divisions involved in supplier diversity with the goal of producing a national practice policy. Based on Jessica’s contributions at that important and challenging meeting alone, I would say that she brings a great breath of knowledge, experience and positive energy to bear on addressing challenges and leveraging opportunities for the company. I’ve since had the opportunity to participate in other events and meetings where Jessica has again and again confirmed and reinforced this first impression with ever-growing superior performance. In my opinion, Jessica is an extremely valuable contributor to the company that continues to grow to even greater peak levels and who I believe, based on this track record, will move to even greater heights of contribution in the future.

recommendations.name: Ankwetta B. Achaleke
recommendations.subtitle: Founder & Steward — GloBUNTU® Global | Ubuntu-informed leadership, healing & storytelling
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Ankwetta B. but they were at different companies
recommendations.description: Beatrice Achaleke is clearly an innovative starter. A quick look at her background and you cannot miss seeing multiple appearances of words that describe her as a founder, a first and an initiator. Clearly she is someone who is, and will continue to be for many years to come, at the forefront of Diversity and inclusion on the global stage.

recommendations.name: Bill Shulman
recommendations.subtitle: Certified Business Performance Advisor at Insperity
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Bill but on different teams
recommendations.description: I had the pleasure of working with Bill when he was a Practice Manager in our IT consulting services area. In my opinion Bill was one of the best examples of someone who excels as both a technology expert and a people manager. During his tenure in this role, I often saw Bill equally in his element when creating a technical solution for one of his clients as he was when designing a career path for one of his consultants. The result of this combined application in technology and people skills was his ability to attract, develop and engage a highly effective consulting team that under Bill’s leadership provided top-notch competitive IT solutions to our clients. As someone who personally observed and interviewed hundreds of IT managers for a 2003 book I authored on the topic of transitioning into IT management, I know that Bill’s combination of technology and people skills is indeed both very rare and of high competitive value.

recommendations.name: Renato C.
recommendations.subtitle: Head of Tax | Global Tax Strategy | TP | Planning | Provision | Compliance | Strategic Partner to Business
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Renato but on different teams
recommendations.description: As co-Chair of the Siemens Corporation Hispanic Employee Resource Group, I found Renato to be a very dedicated and quality conscious professional. For example, after inviting me to be a guest speaker for the Hispanic network, Renato initiated a number of meetings with me designed to make sure that I was well prepared to meet the needs of the participants. He was clearly very focused on ensuring that we had a program of the highest quality. In my experience these traits of thoroughness, ownership and follow-through are generally an integral component of people who possess these qualities, which will always show-up in any assignment they lead.  With this in mind, I highly recommend him for any leadership role.

recommendations.name: Raheem Hasan
recommendations.subtitle: Go-to-Market Strategy & Execution Practitioner | Director, Partner Marketing, UiPath
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Raheem but on different teams
recommendations.description: I’ve had the pleasure of knowing and working with Raheem on a number of different fronts. The most long-standing of these has been in the area of our company’s diversity and inclusion efforts. While clearly a service/marketing/communications expert first, Raheem is very adept at applying his abilities in this other important business dimension. Back in the early 2000’s, as one of the earliest members of the SIS diversity council, he assumed responsibility over the communications strategy development. His combination of business savvy, relationship-building skills and communications skills made him a valuable asset specifically in the proper identification and communication of value in a manner that motivated positive action on the part of stakeholders. Today he continues his efforts as a Vice-Chair of the SIS Council. In this role, I’ve found him to be a passionate champion for SIS’ efforts who seeks to engage and leverage every “diversity and inclusion” resource he can to provide SIS with the most effective competitive advantage in securing talent and as a business partner.

recommendations.name: Nathan Brassard
recommendations.subtitle: Data Migration Lead
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Nathan but on different teams
recommendations.description: I recently had the opportunity to work with Nathan as part of a team designing his organization’s goals and go-forward 2011 diversity strategy.  I found Nathan to be a very incisive out of the box thinker. He specifically has the keen ability to see possibilities beyond the questions and options placed on the table. I personally believe this quality alone makes him a very valuable player in any group that is looking for creative and innovative solutions to business challenges.

recommendations.name: Marco Boos
recommendations.subtitle: Head of Global Supply Chain Management
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Marco but on different teams
recommendations.description: I’ve had the pleasure of partnering with Marco in the development and support of Siemens supplier diversity efforts. Marco is an excellent example of an executive that thinks in terms of the total value of his actions and strategy to the company as opposed to just managing only to one or two narrowly focused function area variables. His ability to balance and meet the demands and targets of his procurement area while at the same supporting and taking actions that benefited the entire enterprise across a number of functions including the revenue driving sales area are evidence of a highly organized leader that can see both the large and small picture and manage them towards the most optimal result.

recommendations.name: Merrick Reed (2055+)
recommendations.subtitle: Supplier Diversity Specialist at Siemens Enterprise Communications
recommendations.context: Joseph was senior to Merrick but didn't manage Merrick directly
recommendations.description: I had the pleasure of working with Merrick Reed when I first started in my role as Senior Director, Diversity for Siemens in the USA. My specfic work relationship with Merrick was twofold. First, he was on the original team that worked with me to forge a single national diversity practice out of our various USA company efforts. Second, he was a key figure in the outreach efforts of our Siemens Corporate African American employee network. In both roles, I found Merrick’s dedication to success and selfless personal passion were huge assets towards our success. It was a pleasure to mentor and teach someone who immediately applied and built upon every single thing he learned.

recommendations.name: Kellye Whitney
recommendations.subtitle: Communications & Culture Strategist | Author of Live Well
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Kellye but they were at different companies
recommendations.description: I’ve had the pleasure of working with Kellye this past year in her role as Managing Editor at MediaTec Publishing in the publication of a featured article and two newsletter articles I authored for Diversity Executive Magazine. I found her to be a very thorough and highly engaged editor that works with her authors to ensure the highest level of value for her magazine readers. I’ve also experience great follow-up on Kellye’s part in keeping me in the loop on the activity around my published articles. In addition to all this, I’ve read a number of Kellye’s articles and found her to be as completely thorough as a journalist as she clearly is as an editor. I highly recommend her and her work.

recommendations.name: Michael Lemm, Information Technology
recommendations.subtitle: Custom Design & Sourcing For Network Connectivity, Cybersecurity, Unified Communications, Cloud, AI, IoT/IIoT, Digital Transformation, & Industry 4.0 Solutions, 2022 & 2023 Who's Who In Industry 4.0
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Michael but they were at different companies
recommendations.description: I’ve known Michael since the days when I started a global exchange network on Ryze back in the early 2000’s in which he was a very active member.  Back then as now, Michael continues to be an intelligent and generous source of reliable information. Through his contributions of time, energy and his experience, he’s clearly earned the respect of colleagues and clients. I highly recommend him.

recommendations.name: Karen Terry, CPC, SPHR
recommendations.subtitle: Senior HR Business Partner @ Siemens Gamesa | M.S. IO Psych
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Karen but on different teams
recommendations.description: I first met Karen Terry in 2003 when I was a visiting speaker at the Energy diversity event in Orlando. It was clear to me from that first visit that Karen was a very competent and efficient HR professional who invested a great deal of her personal passion and energy to the work of her Sectors diversity councils and resource groups. Over the course of seven years as I’ve watched many diversity council Chairs, members and other group leaders come and go, Karen has always been and continues to be a constant and integral part of the Energy team’s efforts and, in my opinion, a key factor in the evolving successes they’ve enjoyed in this space. Given her contributions to her Sector and the cascading positive impact on all of our companies in the United States, I consider Karen a huge asset to our diversity efforts in Energy as well as the Siemens USA Cluster.

recommendations.name: Juliann Nutaitis
recommendations.subtitle: Human Resources & Talent Acquisition
recommendations.context: Joseph was senior to Juliann but didn't manage Juliann directly
recommendations.description:
In my role as Sr. Director, Diversity, I met Julie late 2005 as one of the four co-Chairs of the then recently founded Women’s Information Network at Siemens (WINS). Of those original four, Julie was one of two that actually stayed with the effort during its taxing growth and development stage. Over the course of the four years that followed, I watched how Julie personally develop herself and invested each of her new found skills and competencies as an organizer, coach, mentor, leader, succession planner and event manager coupled with her pre-existing relationship-building skills, forged out of her experience in recruiting, to build WINS into the mature and valuable network it is today. All of this was done, while still putting in a full effort into her day job and taking in other extra assignments from time to time.  Recently Julie retired from her successful run as a co-Chair and promptly joined the networks Advisory Board, where she continues to provide guidance and advice to the two new recently appointed leaders.

Through her work with WINS, I’ve seen Julie demonstrate a strong combination of leadership, tenacity and the ability to continue to adapt and grow as a versatilist. She also possesses a strong desire and ability to help others to grow and develop as well. Julie is one of those rare people who brings a combination of self-confidence and leadership, while remaining open to learning from others. I can personally attest to the fact that each and every award listed on this profile was earned through her hard work, dedication and valuable contributions to our diversity and corporate citizenship efforts.

recommendations.name: Michael Grunberg
recommendations.subtitle: CEO, Atos Group - Americas GEO
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Michael on the same team
recommendations.description: Mike and I were partners in support of the Morgan Stanley account for a little over two years. At the time, I was in charge of Operations and Mike was the account’s Client Executive focused on new sales and expanding our relationship with this relatively new strategic account. During my first few months leading the operations team, I immediately came to appreciate and rely on Mike’s intimate knowledge of the customer’s environment, culture and requirements. This was a huge asset in getting me up to speed quickly. Mike also showed a phenomenal ability to anticipate Morgan Stanley’s needs, fashion solutions and work with all part of the company including Legal, Solution Architects, Finance and myself to ensure delivery of service on-time, on-budget and at a quality level that met or exceeded this client’s expectations. I was never shy about publically stating in meetings at our Area office that I considered myself fortunate to have Mike Grunberg as a partner on such a challenging assignment. It came as no surprise after I moved on to other assignments, when I heard that Mike had grown Morgan Stanley into a global account. Interesting enough, despite having more than a full plate of customer-related activities, during this time Mike also identified, mentored and developed other talented people into Client Executive roles. Mike is an extremely talented executive and leader that I respect and highly recommend.

recommendations.name: Sybil (aka Dee) Faulcon
recommendations.subtitle: OPEN TO WORK: Sr. Global Technical Talent Acquisition Partner w/extensive technical, corporate, diversity and executive recruiting experience within major fortune 50 and agency organizations.
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Sybil (aka Dee) but on different teams
recommendations.description: During the time that she worked for Siemens, Sybil brokered a number of great relationships with organizations across the entire spectrum of diversity. She also followed-through maintaining, nurturing and developing these relationships. I found here skill, talent and energy for our company's diversity effort unmatched. I highly recommend her to anyone looking for a tireless and dedicated person that produces results.

recommendations.name: Tyronne Stoudemire
recommendations.subtitle: Global Visionary |Global Head of Strategic Partnerships at Hyatt Corporation | Author of Diversity Done Right | Guiding Leaders to Transform Workplace Culture and Drive Inclusive Excellence
recommendations.context: Joseph worked with Tyronne but they were at different companies
recommendations.description: Tyronne is an excellent facilitator and teacher. I found his handling of a program I attended about two years ago enjoyable as well as insightful. I highly recommend him as a program moderator.

recommendations.name: Mohini Parchure
recommendations.subtitle: HR Specialist Employee Relations at Veterans Health Administration
recommendations.context: Joseph managed Mohini directly
recommendations.description: I’ve worked with Mohini on several big and small projects and I highly recommend her as someone who is extremely smart and resourceful as well as totally dedicated to doing the very best job. Mohini is very quick at grasping new concepts, adding them to her skill portfolio and putting them immediately to work toward achieving results.

headline: LinkedIn Virtual Assistant for Busy Founders | Helping B2B Leaders Generate Clients & Build Thought Leadership Through LinkedIn | See testimonials in my Featured
about:
Most B2B founders get views on LinkedIn but no real sales conversations.

I help turn LinkedIn profiles into inbound assets that attract the right people and lead to booked calls.

I do this by aligning three things that most profiles miss
- Profile positioning that is clear and buyer focused
- Content direction that reinforces authority
- Inbound structure that makes it easy to take the next step

This approach is built from real client work, not theory.
You can see the results, testimonials, and profile examples below.

publications.title: Everything You Need to Know About Working With a Virtual Assistant
publications.summary: Today, you’ve got access to numerous tools and websites that will make outsourcing quick and easy. Since you value your time, working with a virtual assistant may be the best choice for you.  With the ease of digital technology, hiring a virtual assistant (VA) can be a cost-effective and productive way to run your business’s daily tasks and administrative functions from anywhere in the country or even across the globe. A virtual assistant is a great way to streamline and grow your business so that you can focus on what’s most important. Here’s everything that you need to know when hiring a virtual assistant.

publications.title: How To Get More Leads to Your Dog Walking Website
publications.summary: For some businesses, it’s easy. They have a product or service that can be sold to the general public on store shelves or through a creative TV ad. But what if you own a dog walking business? How do you get leads and prospects? As a dog walker, you’re probably wondering if there’s a better way to get new leads—and the answer is yes! When you take advantage of the tips and tricks that we’re going to discuss below, you will see how your neighborhood dog walking business can grow to a furry friend empire.

publications.title: Looking for a Virtual Assistant? Here’s How to Hire One
publications.summary: Finding a virtual assistant can be a time-saving, cost-effective solution for many businesses. Virtual assistants can help out with administrative tasks, help with specific tasks and report to you if needed. Some work for as little as $10 an hour while others can cost up to $40,000 a year!

publications.title: Should You Invest In Website Design? Here Are The Top 3 Reasons To Get One
publications.summary: Whether you’re a small, medium or large enterprise, having a website represents your business’ digital identity. As you accumulate more customer data through your web pages or mobile app, the value of your brand only increases. Whether you’re a budding entrepreneur looking to create a quick website for yourself or an established corporation looking to invest in a well-designed and scalable enterprise application design, your website is critical to the growth of your business and its marketing strategy. From driving sales to increasing customer engagement and even fundraising, no matter what business you’re in, having a website has become the key to getting ahead in today’s marketplace. Here are 3 reasons to invest in website design:

publications.title: What Is SEO? And Why You Should Care
publications.summary: Are you just starting with SEO? You may have heard that SEO can bring more people to your website and help you increase rankings, but you may not know how it works or what it is. Now you’re in the right place. Find out what every online marketer should know about SEO by reading on.

publications.title: Your Website is Your Online Business card: Here’s why you should build a website in 2022
publications.summary: What’s the impact of building a website for your small business? The latest statistics show that businesses that invest in creating a website are 61% more likely to earn between $100,000 and $1M in annual revenue. Therefore, owning a website can be an exciting and lucrative path for your small business. Still not convinced? Here are the top benefits to building a website for your small business.

headline: Head Sage at SageScreen.  We make AI interviews transparent and ethical.
about: As a seasoned Senior Technology Leader, I specialize in transformations and data-driven strategies, focusing strongly on AI, ML, and DevOps. A certified AWS Architect, Agile (CSM, CSP), and PMP, I excel in leading high-performance teams through coaching to drive technological advancements and operational efficiencies. My expertise includes overseeing complex mergers and ensuring seamless integration and strategic alignment, significantly enhancing revenue growth, and ensuring compliance in highly regulated industries.

experiences.title: CTO & Head Sage
experiences.jobDescription:
I spend my days turning hiring theater into signal: less noise, fewer fake candidates, faster decisions.
We don’t replace humans. We stop wasting their time.

Building systems where trust is designed in, not bolted on later.

experiences.title: Sr. Director of Engineering
experiences.jobDescription: Architected and led the 0→1 build of an agentic AI platform for real-time medical supply procurement, designing event-driven systems on AWS and delivering intelligent automation with my team through scalable infrastructure and robust CI/CD.

experiences.title: VP of Platform Engineering
experiences.jobDescription: In my leadership role, I steered the development and deployment of transformative AI technologies, significantly enhancing operational efficiency and driving revenue growth. By innovating legacy systems into state-of-the-art, self-optimizing platforms, we achieved unprecedented accuracy and speed in our solutions. My direction in navigating rigorous SOC2, HiTrust, and ISO compliance processes further established our reputation for delivering secure, reliable, and cutting-edge AI solutions to demanding industries.

experiences.title: Director of Software Engineering
experiences.jobDescription: I championed SOC2 compliance, significantly boosting stakeholder confidence through enhanced security and process improvements. I led the design and implementation of an AWS Cognito-based Identity Management solution, slashing management costs by 35% and elevating security. My efforts in introducing a Salesforce wrapper service cut data duplication by 80%, optimizing efficiency. Additionally, I founded Agile and Architecture Centers of Excellence, streamlining delivery and boosting team morale, while our new Agile-based SDLC improved project speed, quality, and security.

experiences.title: Sr. Director of Software Engineering
experiences.jobDescription: Leading the SecDevOps transformation for over 100 agile teams at a top US bank, I significantly enhanced release reliability by more than 140% and cut release time and effort by 70%. I collaborated with external clients to modernize their CI/CD pipelines, leveraging tools like Bitbucket, Terraform, and Kubernetes, resulting in faster and more reliable releases. My architectural expertise enabled the creation of a cloud-based machine learning platform for document handling, capable of processing over 1 million documents monthly. I also developed and led training on best practices for security, reliability, and efficiency for federal agencies and a Fortune 500 retailer, drastically reducing manual interventions. Additionally, I founded a DevOps team that revolutionized the release process, reducing overall release time from a month to under three days through the adoption of Azure DevOps and Jenkins.

experiences.title: Vice President Information Technology
experiences.jobDescription: As CTO of three subsidiaries, I guided our teams in transitioning to AWS cloud, leveraging serverless tech and containers to cut release times by 60% and boost security. My leadership through two acquisitions expanded our revenue by 300% and integrated technologies to enhance efficiency. I innovated with a dashboard that cut labor costs by 20% and developed a mobile app, increasing market share by 11%. Our migration to AWS slashed costs by 80%, improved scalability, and ensured SOC2 compliance. By automating tasks with OCR and machine learning, we reduced manual dependencies, and our initiatives in application security and identity management solutions streamlined customer onboarding while enhancing security.

experiences.title: Sr. Manager of Software Engineering
experiences.jobDescription: I drove the development and AWS deployment of a solution bridging legacy mainframe systems with modern interfaces, enhancing user experiences and projected to save over $1M/year. I successfully managed the transition of thousands of mortgages during Capital One's divestiture, ensuring a flawless process with no InfoSec issues. My initiatives in migrating APIs and Microservices to AWS ECS resulted in improved security and a 40% reduction in maintenance costs. I introduced automated testing with Jasmine and Protractor, significantly reducing defects. Additionally, I played a key role in pioneering Robotic Process Automation within financial services, leading to cost reductions and increased accuracy in critical operations.

experiences.title: Enterprise Agile Coach - Consultant

recommendationsReceived.name: Doug Johnson, RPIAC
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Web Developer, Marketing Department at Southwestern Health Resources
recommendationsReceived.context: Doug managed Ryan C directly
recommendationsReceived.description:
I worked with Ryan as a senior dev under his Director of Engineering direction at Taylor.
It was one of the best team development experiences of my life. Ryan has the ability to gather and motivate a group of excellent individuals. The culture of the place is like a startup, but within the bounds of a large, more established company. He keeps the focus on the end goal and makes sure that everyone understands where the team is headed. He has little tolerance for the kind of pettiness that can derail a team and eliminates it by directing everyone back to the purpose of the sprint. He bore the brunt of outside interference, insulating his teams from distractions at a time when the company was refocusing its direction, particularly in technology. He gets the best out of good people. For those who aren't as good for the team, he cuts his and their losses quickly, allowing them to find a better situation for their talents while not dragging the rest of the team down trying to prop up someone who didn't turn out to be the proper fit or able to handle the intensity.
He encourages growth by junior and senior members. He coached me to help younger members of the group reach their potential. As a result, small intense teams accomplished far more than more experienced teams I've worked with at other companies. The atmosphere is energetic and intense, but satisfying. I've never been so tired at the end of the day, but also proud of the work that we were able to accomplish. Ryan knows how to build that environment and spirit, one of the best managers and people I've known.

recommendationsReceived.name: Reid Nabinger
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Senior DevOps Engineer, Linux and Unix SME -- codifying infrastructure since before there were tools for it.

recommendationsReceived.description:
At AAC, I was the Sr. DevOps Engineer, and in that role I was in constant communication with Ryan and his teams.  One thing about working with Ryan, is that his goals are very clear, and communication with him is easy and effective.

Ryan is extremely technical for his role, and that benefits not only his team enormously, but any team that needs to interface directly with them.  If I had concerns about the trajectory of a certain project, or if there were processes that could be improved, Ryan is open to criticism and will get his hands dirty on a technical level to correct these things.

As for his own team, Ryan acts as a mentor and catalyst to performant and reliable code.  He does things the right way the first time, and isn't in favor of applying band-aid after band-aid until the problem is no longer even recognizable.  Ryan has proven to be a valuable asset to his team as well as mine, and any technical worker would be lucky to report to him.

recommendationsReceived.name: Kara Roberson
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Digital Marketing Manager at Advanced Grower Solutions
recommendationsReceived.context: Kara worked with Ryan C but on different teams
recommendationsReceived.description: Ryan has a remarkable ability to take an idea, ask pertinent questions and then make that idea reality; successfully driving projects from conception to completion. The custom plugins he created allowed our marketing department to venture into new areas. Ryan is results oriented and aligns what he does toward achieving company goals. He leads teams and has the experience to develop and manage his employees; I am better at my job for having the opportunity to work with him. His knowledge and expertise is unequaled, making every project he worked on a great success.

recommendationsReceived.name: Robert Howard III
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Technology Strategy @ Thomson Reuters | ✨Product Creator | Board Member | Mentor & Business Resource Champion
recommendationsReceived.context: Robert reported directly to Ryan C
recommendationsReceived.description:
Working under the wings of Ryan was an awesome experience. He is very knowledgeable and has a vast amount of experience in development that has no limits. I've witnessed Ryan take on projects with little to no specifics, and transform those projects into full scale deliverables within a short amount of time. Need to get a project DONE, and done RIGHT - Ryan is the person for the job! 

I learned a great amount working under Ryan and found his approach to application development superior to any other developer I've had the pleasure of working with. His hands off style of letting the developer develop a plan for creating a deliverable was beneficial as it allowed me to be challenged as well as learn along the way. Ryan is a very good manager and possesses fantastic relationship management skills.  

Overall, Ryan is an excellent Application Developer, Application Development Manager & Project Manager and I'm honored to have had the pleasure of working with him.

recommendations.name: Scott Spencer, MSCS
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Tech & Engineering Exec | SaaS, Agile & DevSecOps | Scaled Global Teams (600+) | $125M ➜ $750M Growth | AI/ML | Cloud | Cybersecurity | GRC | Fintech, Healthtech, & Regulated Industries | CTO/CIO/VP Candidate
recommendations.context: Ryan C reported directly to Scott
recommendations.description:
I had the opportunity as a direct report to Scott for 4 months at First American. After being hired by Scott, my first day, I was greeted with a very in-depth and thoughtful onboarding plan.  It wasn't the usual "goals" and here is how to make it past 90 days.  This plan included the names and roles of over 50 people that I needed to meet, get to know, and form a relationship with in order to be successful.  Scott took the time to look far ahead in my progression in that new role and plan how to make long-term connections so critical to getting results in a large organization.  I have never had an onboarding plan like it, and I doubt I ever will again.

He is well versed on software development patterns as well as project and product management.  His greatest strength lies in his ability to form and maintain connections with vast numbers of people, a huge asset in a large company like First American.

Scott is a thoughtful leader and one that listens well in addition to being very clear on setting expectations.  He was always available for questions on the best "how" in a company that was new to me, and I enjoyed our time, albeit short, working together.

recommendations.name: Matt Coleman
recommendations.subtitle: Engineering at Doordash
recommendations.context: Ryan C managed Matt directly
recommendations.description: I have never worked with an engineer that was a more engaged team player.  No matter the task, from coding to testing to automated deployment to learning, if the team needed it to achieve the goals, Matt was there plugging the gap.  A ravenous learner, he would absorb a new process or method and not only implement it, but teach the rest of the team how to use it.  He was one of the first of the team to become AWS certified and helped coach other members, including me.  Productive, consistent, and deeply committed to quality, Matt often pushed boundaries and formed relationships to deliver value and grow the skillset of the team.  I would be very excited with the oppurutunity to work with Matt in the future.

recommendations.name: Swathi Vijayaprakash
recommendations.subtitle: Software Engineer at Microsoft
recommendations.context: Ryan C managed Swathi directly
recommendations.description:
I had the distinct pleasure and honor of being Swathi's direct leader for just under a year.  In that time, I watched her grow as an engineer, develop her innate leadership abilities, and ensure her future as an indispensable part of any software engineering team.

Swathi is strong full stack (Java, JavaScript (AngularJS), Cassandra, PostgresQL, AWS) engineer, a great collaborator, and advocate for Agile.  She always strives for quality as demonstrated by her eagerness to pick up testing suites (e.g. Jasmine, Protractor) and ensure the solutions are complete, accurate, and scalable.

Her leadership from within the team was exceptional.  She mentors new team members without hesitation and in a very deliberate way ensuring the new team member feels included and grounded.  She was the first on the team to attain an AWS certification and then immediately spent time as a guide for the other team members through this difficult and sometimes arduous journey of learning.  She is a capable presenter and comfortable speaking in front of groups.

One of Swathi's most outstanding traits would be her ownership.  I knew, without a doubt, if Swathi said she "had it", she did.  No matter the task, or challenge, from front-end development to maintaining legacy systems to interfacing directly with customers to designing data models,  Swathi's sense of ownership and pride in her work gave me the confidence to continually push and challenge her.  

Any team, regardless of level or direction, would benefit from her technical acumen, her drive, and her consistent demonstration of leadership at all levels.  Working closely with her she taught me many things, and I have no doubt she will excel and bring value to anything to which she sets her mind.

recommendations.name: Conor Delanbanque
recommendations.subtitle: CEO & Founder @ Strategio | Forbes 30 Under 30
recommendations.context: Ryan C was Conor's client
recommendations.description:
Conor's attention to detail as well as his strong advocacy of his contractors is probably the best I have ever had the honor of experiencing.  From his positive attitude and his willingness to go to bat for what is right and best for his resources, he ensured, personally most of the time, the engagement, at least from a structure standpoint, would be a resounding success.

It was not a perfect or completely smooth engagement, but this is due to no fault on Conor or his team's part.  They consistently were attentive and communicative throughout the entire process.

I would work with Salt in the future and Conor specifically based on my first-hand experiences with this contract.

recommendations.name: Pavel Moravec
recommendations.subtitle: front-end / UI developer at INDG | GRIP: CSS, Typescript, Javascript, React, Storybook, Figma
recommendations.context: Ryan C was senior to Pavel but didn't manage Pavel directly
recommendations.description:
Pavel is very easy to work with.  He would come to meetings, both virtually and in person, armed and ready with questions and ideas to improve our UI designs and challenge any preconceived notions we had to make sure we were taking into account use cases, even those fringe ones.

His front end designs and implementations were easy to understand and engaging to use.  What else are you looking for in an interface?  He was a great addition to the team whether it be as directly integrated into the team on a large project or more individual contributor one-off tasks to be integrated later.

I would welcome the chance to work with Pavel again in the future, and no matter what, I sincerely hope our paths cross once more.

recommendations.name: Mike Metcalf
recommendations.subtitle: Software Engineer/System Architect
recommendations.context: Ryan C managed Mike directly
recommendations.description: Mike has a ton of experience in JAVA & C, among other things.  He is also extremely proficient in AngularJS and dabbled in React.  There is also some PHP and Python in there for flavor.  In the three years I worked with Mike, I never saw anything other than a Sr Architect level software engineering with a very willing attitude to jump in and tackle any technical challenge.  If Mike and I discussed it, I just left it there.  I knew it would be done and done well and he would come to me if he needed something.  I would work with Mike anywhere, anytime, on any project.

recommendations.name: Jason Baxter
recommendations.subtitle: “The secret of getting ahead is getting started.”
recommendations.context: Ryan C managed Jason directly
recommendations.description:
Jason is an innovative and multi-faceted team member, with skills ranging from SEO to coding HTML/CSS to UX/UI.  His design work over the last year has really moved our project forward and in such a way that stakeholders not only support it, but actually applaud the aesthetics of the application.

Our application is a very complex multi-layered web application, constructed of many intertwined event driven concepts, and presented to our customers, many of whom are not particularly technical.  Jason's efforts have created an interface that not only allows our user base to use this application and its inherit features to the fullest, but also enabled the users to not feel the task is daunting and unattainable.

The time Jason has spent with this team has been invaluable and we would not be where we are without his contributions, his passion, or his vision.

recommendations.name: John Beauford
recommendations.subtitle: President | CTO at Advanced Grower Solutions, L.L.C.
recommendations.context: Ryan C reported directly to John
recommendations.description:
John is easily the most technical leader I have ever had, but he is tempered enough to not interfere directly with the individual contributors or leadership under him.

John is loyal and resilient, always driven and determined to make the most positive impact on the company and the people around him day after day.  I watched John stay until the early morning hours giving support to us as we worked through technical issues or releases, even though he didn't write any of the code being promoted. He continuously acts as a servant leader by offering advice, helping in the trenches, and keeping the caffeine flowing.  Even after a 20 hour day, a few short hours later, John would be back at the office to give first line customer, both internal and external, support keeping the technical resources freed up to react to unanticipated eventualities.

I would work with John anywhere, anytime, on anything.  I will always continue to think the extraordinary example of a leader which he exemplifies, and use those lessons in my own career.

recommendations.name: Courtney Zimmerman
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Product Manager at UWorld
recommendations.context: Ryan C worked with Courtney but on different teams
recommendations.description:
Courtney is dedicated, detail oriented, and organized, a great combination for any team in any market.

During the ~18 months I worked closely with Courtney as we were the primary communication link between Marketing (Courtney's department) and IT (my department).  I found her knowledgeable and approachable and thoroughly enjoyed working with her.  Her ability to convey complex details in an organized and logical manner facilitated easy communication and high productivity as technical needs were met quickly and efficiently. 

I would look forward to working with her again in whatever capacity we might find ourselves.

recommendations.name: Luke Hejl
recommendations.subtitle: CEO // Founder at TimelyCare (Inc. 5000, Top 10 Fastest Growing Health Services Company)
recommendations.context: Ryan C worked with Luke but on different teams
recommendations.description:
Marketing at DIT is far more like inside sales than traditional marketing.  That being said, Luke took it, and grew it using both his extensive marketing knowledge and acumen as well as his innate salesmanship.  I watched sales pulled out of thin air due to Luke and his team's ability to understand our customers and then reach them, where they are, in such a way that it felt natural and easy, not a hard sale, but something that just flowed.

Regardless of where I end up, I would always keep Luke in mind for any outside or inside sales as well as any social media/new media marketing needs. I am confident he would approach it with the same drive and unique outlooks as I have experienced working with him at DIT, and I would welcome it.

recommendations.name: Robert “Joey” Werkmeister
recommendations.subtitle: Director- Experience & Product @ Capgemini | Strategy | Research | Mentorship
recommendations.context: Ryan C was senior to Robert “Joey” but didn't manage Robert “Joey” directly
recommendations.description:
No matter what I say, it will be insufficient to express my admiration for Robert's skills as a designer and overall understanding of the nuances of User Interface Design.

His designs are clean, easy to use, and easy to understand despite being very dense with information.  Robert spends his free time learning and expanding his knowledge keeping designs free and cutting edge.

I would gladly have Robert on any team I form or am part of in the future.

headline: Senior Partner, Leader in Transformation & Change and Energy & Natural Resources practices at Bain & Company
about:
I’m a partner at Bain and a Leader in the firm's Transformation & Change and Performance Improvement practices. I’m also a member of the Energy & Natural Resources, Utilities & Renewables and Advanced Manufacturing & Services industries. 

Over the past 26 years, I helped organizations across a broad array of industries including the commercial aviation, military defense & space segments, utilities, consumer products, technology, telecommunications and manufacturing.
 
I worked with senior leaders to develop and implement competitive, sustainable growth strategies as well as dramatically improve operational performance. My expertise covers new capability development, competitive analysis, M&A, operational efficiency redesign, sustained cost reduction, operating model design and performance management.

Prior to joining Bain in 2004, I was a senior manager at Deloitte where I worked in finance and business development for Raytheon (formerly Hughes Aircraft Company) in Southern California.

experiences.title: Senior Partner
experiences.jobDescription:
Bain & Company is the management consulting firm the world's business leaders come to when they want enduring results.
Tina has more than 26 years of management consulting experience, helping clients to develop and implement competitive, sustainable growth strategies, as well as dramatically improve operational performance. On growth, she has led significant consulting efforts in the areas of market growth and new capability development, competitive analysis and M&A. On performance improvement, she has deep expertise in operational efficiency redesign, sustained cost reduction, operating model design and performance management.
Within the utilities sector, Tina has led operational improvement efforts with a focus in the transmission and distribution operations businesses. She specializes in field force operations and broad work management efficiencies across utilities, telecommunications and related industries.
Tina has served virtually all leading US aerospace and defense companies at the prime contractor level, as well as many prominent Tier One and Tier Two suppliers globally. She has experience across a broad array of industry domains including the commercial aviation, military defense and space segments.
Tina holds additional expertise across a range of industries, including consumer products, technology, telecommunications and manufacturing.

headline: Senior Creative Director at Bain & Company
about:
As a Senior Creative Director, I align creative vision with business strategy to deliver impactful results and drive global brand growth. I specialize in crafting and upholding cohesive brand standards, ensuring a consistent visual identity across all communication touchpoints. With expertise in design leadership, international campaigns, and creative delivery, I oversee complex projects, managing goals, budgets, and timelines while fostering innovation and excellence.

I lead and empower diverse creative teams, mentoring senior leaders and collaborating with external agencies to optimize performance and exceed expectations. By staying at the forefront of industry trends and emerging technologies, I bring innovative solutions to the creative process, championing results that resonate globally and move organizations forward.

recommendations.name: Kelly Garrett
recommendations.subtitle: Executive Support / Project Manager / Creative Operations
recommendations.context: Dawn worked with Kelly on the same team
recommendations.description:
I had the absolute pleasure of working with Kelly, and I can confidently say she is one of the most exceptional professionals I’ve encountered. No task was ever too big or too small for her—she approached every challenge with enthusiasm, efficiency, high quality and a positive, “can-do” mindset that inspired everyone around her.

Kelly is the definition of a team player. Her customer-focused approach consistently exceeded expectations, and her ability to support others while keeping projects organized and on track was invaluable. During our time working together, she was a critical part of the Visual Identity Refresh project, where her organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to meet deadlines played a significant role in our success.

Beyond her technical and organizational strengths, Kelly brings an unmatched energy and positivity to the workplace. She creates a sense of lightness and warmth in every interaction, making her a true asset to any team. Her ability to radiate kindness, professionalism, and reliability while delivering high-quality results sets her apart.

Any organization would be lucky to have Kelly on their team. She possesses the talent, drive, and skills to thrive in any environment, and I’m confident she will continue to achieve great things. I wholeheartedly recommend her as a colleague, partner, or leader for any project or role she pursues.

recommendations.name: Grace Kennedy
recommendations.subtitle: Art Director at CBRE | Georgetown University Master’s in Design Management
recommendations.context: Dawn managed Grace directly
recommendations.description:
I am delighted to recommend Grace Kennedy, who has been an invaluable member of our team at Bain. 

From the moment Grace joined us, it was clear she was a rising star. Her exceptional dedication, creativity, and collaborative spirit has significantly contributed to our team's success. Grace consistently brought positivity and enthusiasm to every project, making even the most challenging tasks feel manageable and enjoyable.

Her hard work, leadership skills and innovative thinking has been instrumental in driving our projects forward. Grace possesses an uncanny ability to find solutions and offer fresh perspectives, always going above and beyond to support the team. Whether it was working to do what it took to meet tight deadlines or offering a helping hand to colleagues in need, Grace demonstrated an unwavering commitment to our collective goals.

Beyond her professional skills, Grace is a joy to work with. Her positive attitude and genuine kindness have made her a beloved member of our team.

I have no doubt that Grace will achieve amazing things in the next chapter of her career. Any organization would be fortunate to have such a talented and dedicated individual on their team. I wholeheartedly recommend Grace and look forward to witnessing their continued success.

recommendations.name: Stephen Potter
recommendations.subtitle: Creative Direction, Brand Strategy, Team Leadership
recommendations.context: Dawn worked with Stephen on the same team
recommendations.description:
Stephen Potter is an exceptional Creative Director whose talents extend across the entire creative spectrum. From copywriting and creative concepting to UI/UX design and coaching, Stephen excels in every facet of the field. His outstanding stakeholder management and relationship-building skills are unparalleled, and his ability to deliver compelling design pitches to clients sets him apart.

Stephen's creativity is truly inspiring, consistently elevating the quality of our work. Beyond his professional expertise, he is a genuine culture carrier and an invaluable collaborator. His humility, kindness, and caring nature greatly enhance the working environment, making every project more enjoyable and productive.

I am incredibly grateful for the opportunity to work with Stephen and look forward to future collaborations. He has significantly contributed to our team, and I am so thankful for all he has brought to the table.

recommendations.name: Lisa Wright
recommendations.subtitle: Design/Animation
recommendations.context: Dawn was senior to Lisa but didn't manage Lisa directly
recommendations.description:
Writing a recommendation for Lisa is an absolute joy because she truly is wonderful in every sense! I feel privileged and thankful for the opportunity to work and collaborate with her. Lisa not only embodies our team's culture but elevates it as a true culture carrier. Her boundless positive energy is infectious, making her an open book and a vocal advocate who fearlessly expresses opinions or acts as a supportive cheerleader for her colleagues.

As an exceptionally skilled designer and animator, Lisa operates with speed and brings a wealth of creative ideas to the table. What stands out is her ability to transform static graphics into captivating motion works of art. Working with her on various projects has been a delight, witnessing her true colors shine through.

Beyond her undeniable skills, Lisa is a remarkable person—highly personable, kind, caring, and genuinely giving. She radiates as a bright light and a positive force of nature. Lisa is not only open to new ideas but also welcomes challenges, facing adversity with grace and a constant thirst for learning. I have no doubt that she is destined for great places, utilizing her talents and skills to continually advance.

Any company fortunate enough to work with Lisa is truly lucky. She is not just a wonderful designer but an exceptional human being who adds immense value to any team or project.

recommendations.name: Ayanna Ashley Doiron
recommendations.subtitle: Graphic Designer with a passion for non-profits, people and the planet, changing lives, and doing good in the world.
recommendations.context: Dawn was senior to Ayanna but didn't manage Ayanna directly
recommendations.description:
I had the privilege of working alongside Ayanna, and I can confidently say that she is an invaluable asset to any team. Ayanna's dedication to her craft is unmatched; she is a hardworking, talented, and creative designer who consistently delivers exceptional results.

Her meticulous approach ensures that every design she produces meets the highest standards of quality. Ayanna is not only proactive in identifying and addressing issues but does so with a finesse that is not intrusive, reflecting her consideration for others' time and priorities.

Ayanna's collaborative spirit shines through in her ability to work seamlessly with team members. She is adept at giving and receiving feedback, fostering a positive and constructive working environment. What sets Ayanna apart is her versatility—she has successfully contributed to a diverse range of design projects, always eager to expand her skill set and take on new challenges.

Beyond her professional excellence, Ayanna is a kind and caring individual. Her genuine concern for others and her commitment to making a positive impact on the world make her not just a remarkable colleague but also a wonderful person to know.

I feel fortunate to have had the opportunity to work with Ayanna, and any company that welcomes her aboard is indeed fortunate. Ayanna is a true gem, and her continuous pursuit of excellence and dedication to personal and professional growth make her an outstanding asset to any team.

Gretchen's ability to inject fresh ideas and innovative thinking into our work significantly contributed to our success. Moreover, she has a keen understanding of the importance of maintaining brand consistency and executes her work with meticulous precision, delivering stunning outcomes consistently.

What sets Gretchen apart is not just her design skills but also her dedication to process improvement and adherence to guidelines. Over the years, she has played a pivotal role in enhancing our workflows and guidelines, showcasing her exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills.

I am truly grateful for the opportunity to have collaborated with Gretchen, and I sincerely hope for the chance to work together again in the future. Beyond her professional expertise, Gretchen is a wonderful person with a generous heart, making her an absolute pleasure to work with. I wholeheartedly recommend Gretchen for any design project, confident that she will bring her unique blend of creativity, precision, and dedication to any endeavor she undertakes.

recommendations.name: Anita Allison
recommendations.subtitle: Writer | Producer | Director | Captain
recommendations.context: Dawn worked with Anita on the same team
recommendations.description:
Anita is exceptional at delivering results and high quality results at that! I'm not sure how she does it, but she/her team handle a high volume of work but produce really great work. Anita is continually trying to find ways to keep things fresh, grow, adapt to keep the video team ahead of the curve and on trend with the marketplace. I'm impressed by her innate ability to adapt and turn change into opportunities. Anita has taken video @ Bain to amazing new heights. She's built a department from the ground up and continues to find ways to grow this to ensure she's meeting the needs of the firm. She is often working with in tight timelines and strict budgets, but somehow still is able to make the magic happen and bring our brand to life through video. In addition, Anita is always the first to raise her hand for new initiatives (even outside of her job scope) which continues to lead us to new places/new ideas/new ways of working. Her leadership is exceptional...she's continually trying to find ways to deliver results and add value to Bain's business. She never stops with the status quo. She truly cares about delivering the best that she has and won't stop until it's done (and even then, she's onto the next thing). Her passion and energy is contagious and something I admire very much! 

Strengths
• Creative/Innovative
• Adaptive
• At cause
• Highly knowledgeable
• Engaged/Passionate
• Results-oriented
• Hard working
• Driven
• Great Leader
• Collaborative/Team player

headline: Expert Associate Partner | Chief Architect | Trusted Advisor | Digital and Cloud Transformation Leader
about:
With over 25 years of experience in IT and a proven record of delivering innovative, web-scale solutions, I am a seasoned professional specializing in Cloud, Digital, and distributed technologies. My expertise spans architecture transformation, application modernization, and cloud adoption across Banking and Healthcare.

In my current role as Expert Associate Partner (Chief Architect), I provide strategic guidance and technical leadership in financial and healthcare services, crafting and executing Cloud-First strategies, designing resilient reference architectures, and driving digital transformation for clients.

I have extensive Enterprise and Solution Architecture experience with Fortune 100 clients in Banking, Healthcare, Engineering, Aerospace, Automotive, and Insurance. I have led transformation programs with a total contract value (TCV) exceeding USD 200M. I have also architected and led development of three large-scale multi-tenant B2B SaaS platforms in Healthcare and Employee Benefits, collectively generating over USD 450M in annual revenue.

With over a decade in consulting focused on IT Transformation, Enterprise Architecture, Cloud Strategy, and Application Portfolio Rationalization, I have earned multiple accolades, including four ‘Best Architect’ awards at Wipro. I was also recognized as one of the 'Top Global Chief Architects' at the 2019 ICMG Global EA Awards in New York.

I am passionate about driving innovation, solving complex business problems, and delivering measurable value through technology. Let’s connect to collaborate on transformative IT initiatives.

experiences.title: Expert Associate Partner (Chief Architect)
experiences.jobDescription:
Expert Associate Partner at Bain & Company, partnering with Financial Services and Healthcare clients to design secure, scalable cloud-native platform architectures. In this role, I collaborate closely with client stakeholders to help define and develop robust transformation architectures leading to secure and resilient digital infrastructures.

Defined target state architecture for a cloud-native Decision Intelligence platform for a FinTech with advanced data and AI/ML capabilities, unified identity graphs, and production MLOps, enabling scalable fraud prevention across account opening and payments.

experiences.title: Chief Architect
experiences.jobDescription:
As a Chief Architect at Enterprise Blueprints (BSL of Bain & Company), I advised financial services clients on transformation of their core banking systems.

Worked with a client on their bank-wide modernization initiative to build a new cloud-native core banking platform across LoBs to enhance business agility, operational efficiency, and to deliver better services to their customers.

#FinancialServices #TechnologyLeadership #InnovationInFinance #CoreBanking #Payments

experiences.title: Chief Architect; Wipro Digital and Cloud
experiences.jobDescription:
Chief Architect responsible for Wipro's multi-tenant B2B SaaS Medicare Advantage platform serving 90+ Medicare Advantage Plans within USA generating annual revenue of 50M+ USD.

Responsible for all engineering (DevSecOps), architecture (infrastructure, security, data, and integration), and operational excellence (cost optimization, reliability, and performance) aspects of the platform. Responsible for Mainframe modernization and Cloud Adoption driving agility, efficiency, reliability, and performance of the overall SaaS platform.

Led a team of Senior Architects deployed in Banking and Healthcare accounts, and responsible for solutions, architectural assurance, pre-sales, and building a team of architects in NA region.

experiences.title: Chief Architect; Wipro Digital
experiences.jobDescription:
NA Regional Leader leading a team of Senior Architects of Wipro Digital; responsible for Digital Transformation initiatives including Cloud Strategy, Cloud Readiness Assessment, Transformation Roadmaps, API Strategy and Cloud-native solutions and pre-sales for Banking and Healthcare domains.

Key engagements include -
1. Led Cloud Readiness Assessment and Transformation Roadmap definition for 400+ applications and global scope of 7000+ workloads for a food and drink processing conglomerate corporation.
2. Led mainframe modernization for one of the nation's leading Student Aid Organizations in USA to transform their legacy Mainframe applications to more modern web-based set of applications
3. Led a Cloud Readiness Assessment for an American global computer security software company to move their 800+ applications and 35K+ VM workloads to AWS Cloud
4. Led Cloud-native re-engineering of Data Streaming platform, and Document Storage platform deployed on AWS for an American multinational financial services organization
5. Led re-engineering of a large legacy monolith multi-tenant (hosting 350+ mid-market employers) Benefit Administration B2B SaaS platform into Cloud-native platform for a BPO company (a leader in technology-enabled health, wealth, HR and finance solutions) based in Lincolnshire, IL, USA.
6. Led Enterprise Integration and API strategy, and logical architecture efforts of building an Event Streaming platform (to support 5M+ events per day) to enable real-time integration of multiple applications
7. Led PCI-DSS compliance of a large Bank in India; Led the application transformation; First bank in India to achieve PCI-DSS compliance
8. Defined an Information2Insights Health Analytics platform (Wipro IP) for Medicaid (DHHS/CMS, USA) using IBM products

experiences.title: Principal Architect;  Strategy, Consulting and Architecture
experiences.jobDescription:
Principal Architect responsible for leading architecture consulting engagements across UK and Europe region and ensure architecture delivery at key accounts.

Key engagements at one of the UK’s top 10 credit card companies -
1. Led multiple regulatory compliance (PCI-DSS, DPA, DRIPA) projects to protect customer's personal data and payment card data (that spans ~450 business processes)
2. Led Cloud Readiness Assessment of entire UK application portfolio and built roadmap to Cloud Transformation 
3. Responsible for the Microservices-based Cloud-native Reference Architecture (using AWS, Microservices, API, Open Source, Big Data) for Credit Card domain
4. Led architecture of Web Analytics platform, and QuickCheck capability (critical growth area for customer) to deliver <60 sec decisioning capabilities
5. Led re-engineering of legacy bureaux (CRAs) connectivity platform; and instrumental in few application portfolio rationalization initiatives
6. Led application transformation (as part of a task force identified by CIO) program in bringing the overall stability to the Oracle Fusion Business Service (SOA) and Process (BPM) production platforms

Other key engagements -
1. Led portfolio rationalization of 4000+ applications for a large multinational oil and gas company based in UK; Won ADM business for 5 years
2. Architected a Remote Services Platform (RSP) on Google cloud for a Europe based multinational Healthcare company to remotely manage medical devices in hospitals
3. Led assessment of current state of DevSecOps and built an Implementation Roadmap and Tooling for an Enterprise DevOps team
4. Responsible for building a rule-based automated Cloud Readiness Assessment framework part of Wipro's Cloud Studio as part of Wipro's Cloud Migration offerings.

experiences.title: Global Practice Head; Platform Architecture Competency Center
experiences.jobDescription:
Created a federated model across Wipro practices to cover end-to-end capabilities on Oracle Fusion Middleware and Open Source stacks, and work to provide architecture for full-stack/multi-practice solutions, engage in advisory & assurance services, create seed talent, and represent Wipro in vendor architecture forums.

Worked on defining Software Architecture Metrics for Wipro’s customers to detect the software architectural issues early in the lifecycle promoting observability, testability, and deployability of solutions.

experiences.title: Enterprise Architect; Enterprise Consulting and Architecture Practice
experiences.jobDescription:
Executed and supported multiple consulting and solution architecture engagements of greenfield projects worth approx 60 M USD. During this time, I played a Lead Architect role for two end-to-end large-scale (Auto Insurance and Healthcare) web platform deployments for Wipro's large customer accounts.

Part of Large Deals pre-sales team leveraging expertise from other specialist groups to derive the integrated solutions for 100+ M USD RFPs. Lead contributor to SOA Reference Architecture and its assets along with other team members at Wipro.

Led architecture of a SaaS Health Insurance Platform (HIP) for a not-for-profit organization that provides health, dental, travel, life and income replacement products to individuals and groups in Canada, with a business-centric SOA enabled IT model to support multiple health insurance carriers. This multi-tenant, multi-language enabled SOA based SaaS platform project (TCV 23M+ USD) is one of the engagements of its kind, executed by Wipro.

Responsible to replace several legacy applications for operational efficiency for a large vehicle insurance provider in USA; Improved processes resulting in reduced claims costs, reduced enhancement costs, etc.; Re-architected using a JEE platform (core iWarranty product) with Integration (140+ interfaces) capabilities using SOA design principles (TCV 40M+ USD project).

Defined an end-to-end architecture (part of 2-member team) for an American technology company to enhance the support and maintenance experience for their devices, primarily computers and laptops – including CRM, agent-facing, collaboration, and knowledge management systems.

experiences.title: Solution Architect; Enterprise Architecture Practice
experiences.jobDescription:
Worked as a Solution Architect for multiple accounts at Wipro, and primarily involved in architecting and/or designing the large-scale JEE/Java based distributed applications worth 15 M USD on Sun, Oracle and BEA platforms.
 
Worked as an account-level architect for 4.5 years for a world's largest automaker across their business units. I was part of initial 8-member team for this customer and responsible for account growth up to 600 member team. Performed the lead role for Architectural Review Team (ART) deployed as part of Delivery Management Office (DMO) of Automotive practice at Wipro.

Led design and development of Vehicle Incentive management System (a green-field project of TCV 5M+ USD FPP), a tool that facilitates accurate, consistent real-time incentive creation, validation, and publication of vehicle incentive information an American multinational automaker.

Led design and development of an EPC jobs portal (a green-field project of TCV 5M+ USD FPP) for a large global engineering-construction organization.

Led design and development of Global Online Ownership (a green-field project of TCV 7M+ USD FPP) tool is a part of the global online ownership strategy of an American multinational automaker.

Led design and development of Work Transfer Management System (a green-field project of TCV 4M+ USD FPP) that enables and supports the common BCAG work transfer processes and procedures for a large American multinational airline manufacturer.

experiences.title: Senior Software Engineer; Web Technologies Group
experiences.jobDescription:
Worked as Senior J2EE designer for multiple Java based projects for an American multinational conglomerate corporation. Part of the very first team to implement web-based technologies using Netscape and iPlanet Java Application servers. 

Part of customer's next-generation web application framework team at Eden Prairie, MN, USA, and designed a custom MVC framework to be used across their portfolio of web applications.

recommendationsReceived.context: Steve worked with Srini but they were at different companies
recommendationsReceived.description: I worked with Srini for a number of years where he played a lead architect role for the client partnership with Capital One where I was leading technology transformation programmes. Srini was a valuable and impactful contributor to the strategy and architectural thinking for a number of business critical programmes, including the shaping and delivery of the modernisation of our customer acquisition capabilities, the launch of the market disrupting QuickCheck product and a cross-business PCI-DSS compliance initiative. As well as the architecture skills he brought to the partnership  (SOA, cloud, micro services, etc), Srini provided coaching and mentoring to several of my engineering leads and solutions architects, supporting them in developing and embedding best practices in architecture and software design. Srini is able to advise and influence C-suite stakeholders on technology strategy and invests in understanding business context and industry trends to bring his thought leadership to business problems. He is a great problem solver and would be a great asset to any organisation who wants to transform their business through technology. I wouldn’t hesitate to have him on my team again.

validation_feedback.actual_service: LinkedIn's core business is a B2B software platform (talent solutions, marketing solutions, sales solutions). The CMO's role involves B2B marketing for the platform, but the company is not a B2B marketing *service provider* in the context implied.
validation_feedback.reason: The message inaccurately frames LinkedIn as a B2B marketing service provider rather than a platform. The method ('content + demand gen') is a plausible *part* of B2B marketing but is too vague and incorrectly applied to the company's core function.

final_validation.actual_service: Software platform (LinkedIn) with B2B and consumer elements, encompassing marketing, networking, and recruitment.
final_validation.reason: The message incorrectly reduces LinkedIn's core service to 'B2B platform marketing,' which is an oversimplification and misrepresentation. The suggested method ('brand + demand gen') is a generic marketing tactic, not a specific method for a 'service,' making the question nonsensical in context.

headline: Practice Vice President, Financial Services at Bain & Company
about:
I’m a Vice President in Bain & Company’s Global Banking Practice, based in Toronto. I lead banking knowledge management and intellectual property development for Bain’s Financial Services practice, with a focus on turning data and research into practical insights that help teams and clients make better decisions.

My work centers on understanding bank performance and industry trends, building and curating banking data assets, and partnering with client teams globally to bring the best of Bain to a wide range of banking topics. I also author and contribute to Bain’s banking thought leadership and help translate insights into client-ready perspectives and tools.

I joined Bain in 1995 and have worked with clients across retail banking, life insurance, and asset management, as well as consumer retail and consumer electronics. Over the years, my experience has spanned corporate and business-unit strategy, sales force effectiveness, customer retention, and customer experience.

I hold a BASc (Honours) in Industrial Engineering from the University of Toronto and an MBA from INSEAD (with distinction). I live in Toronto with my husband and children

updates.postText:
Banking M&A is having a modernization moment, and the winners aren’t choosing either scale or scope. They’re combining both to drive efficiency and innovation—the “double helix” of banking dealmaking. 

In our Banking section of Bain’s M&A Report 2026, we found that 2025 bank acquisitions with meaningful scale + scope elements delivered ~30% better valuation gains than deals that leaned primarily one way.

Big thanks to my co-authors Joe Fielding, Harshveer Singh, and Giulio Severo Naso, and to the broader Bain M&A team behind the full report. 

https://lnkd.in/dxBvgju7

headline: AI Platform Architect at Bain & Company
about:
Innovative technology executive and enterprise architect with 25+ years driving digital transformation, AI strategy, and scalable solutions for Fortune 100 companies and premier consulting firms.

As an entrepreneur and technologist, I’ve built software products, led global engineering teams, and architected enterprise systems across the full technology lifecycle—from requirements engineering to solutions delivery. My career spans software development, IT operations, and strategic architecture roles at BCG and Bain & Company, where I’ve shaped technology roadmaps for the world’s leading organizations.

For the past three years, I’ve focused on Generative AI architecture, governance, and solutions design, helping enterprises navigate the complexities of AI adoption while ensuring ethical deployment, data privacy, and regulatory compliance. I specialize in identifying emerging technologies and developing future-back strategies that create competitive advantage.

Core Expertise:
	•	Enterprise & Solutions Architecture | AI/ML Strategy & Implementation
	•	Digital Transformation & Technology Roadmaps | Cross-functional Leadership
	•	AI Governance, Ethics & Data Privacy | Scalable Systems Design
	•	Global Team Management | Product Development & Consulting

I bridge technical depth with business acumen, delivering measurable results in complex, cross-functional environments. Whether building from the ground up or transforming at scale, I turn technology vision into operational reality.
