recommendations.name: Mikhail Gоrbаtоvskiy
recommendations.subtitle: Improving Call Center Agent Productivity with AI | Founder | IBM Alumnus | Lead Data Scientist
recommendations.context: Ash was Mikhail's client
recommendations.description:
It was a pleasure to collaborate with Mikhail on implementing a real-time agent assist technology for Verizon's consumer call centers. This groundbreaking ML based system provided sub-second recommendations to over 40,000 agents, supporting 700-800k calls daily.

As a rigorous technical leader, Mikhail owned the entire product development lifecycle. He integrated enterprise data, designed AI algorithms, built and scaled ML models, and trained Verizon to operate and improve them. Mikhail then operationalized new recommendation types for various customer service groups, successfully transferring the system to my team.

The innovative system Mikhail architected delivered substantial and sustained ROI to Verizon over many years in production. His critical contributions profoundly impacted our customer care operations, and improved customer satisfaction levels.

I wholeheartedly recommend Mikhail as a preeminent AI expert for customer care operations and an energetic technical leader with the depth and experience to bring ambitious enterprise projects to production scale.

recommendations.name: Kevin Davis
recommendations.subtitle: Communications Leader
recommendations.context: Ash worked with Kevin but on different teams
recommendations.description:
Kevin is a brilliant mass communicator with a rare ability to separate clutter from communication. As a business partner he helped architect a futuristic Intranet platform for a Fortune 20 company and implement it in less than an year. Kevin pushed for social media components as a communications platform thereby increasing overall productivity for frontline and management employees.

Kevin has foresight for communications trends and the ability to identify and leverage technology effectively and meaningfully. As his technology partner I greatly admire his business focused management and execution style.

recommendations.name: Muhammad Qandeel Aslam
recommendations.subtitle: Digital Solutions Technical Lead at Médecins Sans Frontières
recommendations.context: Ash managed Muhammad Qandeel directly
recommendations.description:
I hired Qandeel as an advanced Drupal/PHP architect/developer on a team tasked to build a corporate Intranet from the ground up in March 2009. During the interview itself it was apparent that Qandeel had mastered the technology. During his 2+ years on the project he was instrumental in architecture, design and implementation of complex and key functionality. 

His work ethics and dedication to solving tough solutions was admired and appreciated by business partners and peers alike. He was a highly respected mentor and guide for all other developers. 

From a technology perspective I would rate Qandeel in the top 20 Drupal/PHP developers in the world, based on his contributions and feedback from technical luminaries who assisted with the project.

Qandeel will be an asset  to any project. Given the correct circumstances I would have no hesitation in welcoming him back to my organization.

recommendations.name: Sean Byrnes
recommendations.subtitle: Investor & CEO Coach
recommendations.context: Ash managed Sean directly
recommendations.description: When Sean Byrnes first walked into my office and introduced himself his self confidence was apparent even at that time. Over the next couple of years he raised the bar of excellence in innovation and technical prow-ness as a software architect. Combined with his superior communication skills it was only natural for him to transition into the role of technical entrepreneur. I have full confidence that Sean will one day make a significant positive contribution to the technology landscape.

headline: GTM & Revenue Strategy | Open Group Speaker & Thought Leader | TOGAF & 30x Salesforce Certified
about:
𝗖𝗮𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗯𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝘁 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗮𝗻 𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗻𝘀 𝘁𝗲𝗰𝗵𝗻𝗼𝗹𝗼𝗴𝘆 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗴𝗼𝗮𝗹𝘀?
Hi, my name is Saumya Dash and I am a Principal Enterprise Architect with over 16 years of experience leading high-stakes engagements and developing architecture blueprints that drive significant value creation for customers. Partnering with CxO-level leaders, I secure multi-million-dollar deals by aligning business strategies with technology roadmaps using TOGAF best practices. My unorthodox approach emphasizes deep listening and tailoring solutions to clients’ unique needs, ensuring they are not only technically robust but also culturally aligned.

I make complex ideas accessible and engaging. I’ve helped showcase our innovative Salesforce implementations at industry-leading events like DREAMFORCE.

𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝗔𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀
𝙍𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙣𝙪𝙚 𝙂𝙧𝙤𝙬𝙩𝙝: Led strategic engagements influencing more than $𝟯𝟬 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 in revenue growth for our customers and $𝟱𝟬𝗺+  top line deals for Salesforce.
𝘾𝙤𝙨𝙩 𝙎𝙖𝙫𝙞𝙣𝙜𝙨: People, Process and Technology Optimizations leading to $𝟭𝟬 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 in savings.
𝙊𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙖𝙡 𝙀𝙛𝙛𝙞𝙘𝙞𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙮: Enhanced employee productivity by 𝟭𝟱-𝟯𝟬% through innovative solutions and best practices.
𝘼𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙩 𝙄𝙣𝙛𝙡𝙤𝙬𝙨: Increased asset inflows by approximately $𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗼𝗻 at Edelman Financial Engines through effective Salesforce implementation.
𝑻𝒉𝒐𝒖𝒈𝒉𝒕 𝑳𝒆𝒂𝒅𝒆𝒓𝒔𝒉𝒊𝒑: Keynote speaker at OpenGroup, Houston 2024 event

experiences.title: Principal Enterprise Architect
experiences.jobDescription:
As a pre-sales Enterprise Architect, I partnered with Salesforce customer CxOs and LOB leaders to create architecture blueprints and roadmaps, delivering significant value for shareholders, customers, and employees. I led digital transformation initiatives for over 40 companies.

𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗯𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀:
𝟭. 𝗧𝗿𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗔𝗱𝘃𝗶𝘀𝗼𝗿
• 	Led EA engagements for top strategic customers to close multi-million-dollar deals (>$30 million/year).
• 	Conducted C-suite interviews, business model canvasing, and capability gap analysis.
•	Delivered executive presentations, showcasing future state architecture and business value realization.
𝟮. 𝗧𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿
•	Designed workshops on Data Strategy, Governance, Multi-Org Strategy, Application Rationalization, and Business Model Canvasing.
𝟯. 𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵𝗻𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗣𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗻𝗲𝗿
•	Maximized customer value from Salesforce products (Sales, Service, Marketing, Revenue Cloud, Data Cloud, MuleSoft, Quip, Einstein).
•	Optimized processes around Lead, Account, Opportunity, Forecast, Community Management, and Revenue lifecycle, resulting in higher opportunity close rates and size, forecast accuracy and customer engagement.
𝟰. 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗺 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗿
•	Coordinated internal teams and partnered with solution providers.
•	Aligned with VC, PE firms, and C-suite executives to ensure seamless execution of strategic initiatives.

experiences.title: Senior Enterprise Architect
experiences.jobDescription:
As a Salesforce Enterprise Architect, my primary goal was to lay the foundation of Salesforce Financial Services cloud (FSC) and architect the business processes in a scalable way to help the business generate more revenue by adding value for the advisors and customers. 

To achieve this I: 
•  Defined the enterprise architecture including the application roadmap, business capabilities and application rationalization by leveraging best practices from the TOGAF framework.
• Played a pivotal role in getting our Salesforce implementation highlighted in DREAMFORCE, by being one of the top 5 Salesforce customers to have innovative implementations.
• Designed an efficient prospect call back mechanism that reduced the new prospect response time from 2 days to 2 mins and led to $54M of additional asset inflow within 3 months of launch.
• Increased advisor productivity, Opportunity close rates and size, prevented Lead drop-offs during handoff, resulting in $183M of additional asset inflow.
• Leveraged Copado for release management process to automate deployments and enable capabilities for users quickly.
• Reduced tech debt by prioritizing the use of process builder, flow and other no/low code solutions.
• Achieved SOX and privacy compliance with Salesforce shield.
• Established the integration foundation by setting up MuleSoft platform and AWS infrastructure.
• Revamped the UI by moving to Lightning & implementing Lightning Web Components (LWC).
• Led application rationalization, process unification and data migration through multiple company mergers.
• Ensured Seamless data backup with solutions such as Odaseva.
• Established & stewarded enterprise wide Architecture Governance Board.
• Mentored engineers, leads and other architects.

experiences.title: Technical Architect
experiences.jobDescription:
As a Salesforce Partner, I got to deliver end to end Salesforce implementations for more than 30 customers. I engaged with our customers in many different roles such as:
1. Salesforce Architect: Frequently worked with C-Level executives and business stakeholders in making decisions around Buy vs Build, short/long term strategic roadmap, transition plans, suggesting industry best practices. Worked on Sales, Service and Experience cloud.
2. Integration Architect: From building and integrating standalone SOAP, REST API webservices to leveraging integration platforms such as Informatica, Boomi and Mulesoft.
3. Data Migration Lead: Migrating large data volumes over 100 million, orchestrating the sequence of load. Identifying bottlenecks in data processing and optimizing for production runs.
4. Release Management Architect: Using Change Sets, Ant packages and Jenkins.
5. Developer: Maintaining the balance between configuration(Validation Rules, Workflows, Flows & Process builders) and coding(APEX & visualforce)

experiences.title: Integration Engineer

•Worked on performance initiatives to optimize informatica, salesforce & oracle queries for large data volume. Achieved performance improvements by reducing execution time by up to 70%.
• Achieved 80% reduction in support cases by implementing automated data reconciliation processes.

headline: Partner at Bain & Company
addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
about:
I am a senior executive and trusted advisor with 25+ years of experience driving strategy, product management, digital transformation, and enterprise technology modernization for leading banks, payments networks, and financial services firms worldwide.  My background as a strategy consultant has given me a front-row seat to some of the most complex challenges in banking, payments, fintech, cloud infrastructure, and IT architecture.

As a Partner at Bain & Company and in prior roles, I have led large programs to modernize core banking platforms, reimagine payments ecosystems, and transform technology organizations for agility and resilience. My experience spans partnering directly with boards, C-suite executives, and private equity investors to design and govern complex transformations that unlock growth, reduce operational risk, and deliver superior customer experiences.

If you’re interested in driving transformative change in banking and financial services, let’s connect.

publications.title: Damn, You Still Single?
publications.summary:
To the Girls who sing “No Scrubs” at Karaoke night as their lives depend on it, eye-roll at yet another “we’re engaged” photo, or gag at the thought of answering, “What are you looking for?” for the umpteenth time, Nikki Frias, Tell-It-Like-It-Is Self-help guide, feels your pain.

Following her divorce, Nikki was left to fend for herself in the land of love without an idea of where to start and zero expectations of how it would end. Seven years later...She’s swiping right on rejecting societal expectations, Deleting unasked for d*ck Pics and reclaiming herself in a world obsessed with dating and relationships.

Through comedic anecdotes, relatable stories and practical tips, Damn, You Still Single? is a reflective book about what happens when you navigate the harsh realities of heartbreak with laughter and self-understanding to find maybe, just maybe, a little bit of love along the way.

publications.title: Does This Divorce Make Me Look Fat?
publications.summary:
To the woman trying to rebuild herself but doesn’t know where the f*ck to start, Nikki Frias’s tell-it-like-it-is self-help guide is your new best friend.

Does this divorce make me look fat? Yes, b*tch! Fat with ideas, inspiration, and the power to do what you’ve always talked about.

We’ve all been through some sh*t, and in 2016, Nikki never expected her world to turn upside down from divorce. Yes, the scarlet letter “D” some are too familiar with. After the countless sympathies and questions of the future, she decided to do something about it; live the life she saw for herself. The evolution of sh*tty new boyfriends to ex-boyfriends and roadblocks felt never-ending as she learned to do everything independently. But then she figured out how to conquer the biggest elephant in the room: herself.

What felt like a forced restart pushed Nikki toward the transformation she needed to just get over it already, seriously. This hilariously transparent, witty self-help guide, "Does This Divorce Make Me Look Fat?" is sure to help you do three things: laugh, learn, and move the f*ck on.

Please note: This book can be used for any crisis, not just divorce.

headline: CEO, Channelscaler
about:
I have had the opportunity to work in most areas of a SaaS technology company. I work best when scaling and building organizations, driving the strategy, hiring the team and executing.  My ~20 years in tech working at great companies such as OpenAir (acquired by NetSuite), NetSuite (acquired by Oracle), ForeSee (acquired by Verint) and Litmus (acquired by Validity) have demonstrated that alignment across the organization at all levels on the vision and mission is critical to driving broader success.  Before my ~20 years in technology, I dabbled in strategy consulting at Bain & Company, where I had the pleasure of working with some of the smartest people in the world. I was humbled every day that I came to work.  

Ultimately, I enjoy setting strategy, leading and developing teams, executing to hit key metrics and grooming talent.  Nothing gives me greater pleasure than when our team succeeds or when a customer tells me they love our product and enjoy working with our company.

When not working, I can be found practicing yoga or lifting heavy weights over my head, planning or experiencing my next international vacation, training for a road race or spending time with my wife and kids.

experiences.title: Chief Revenue Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
Litmus was acquired by Validity in April 2025. 

Oversaw sales, account management, customer success, business development, sales operations and enablement functions. 

Built and grew Direct sales organization, scaling team from three to 40 people (high of 70+ in 2021) and global revenue from <$1M to <$50M while achieving rule of 40 metric, 103% NRR and 91% GRR. Grew Direct customer base from <50 to 1,500+ logos and ASP from <$15K to $35K+ while maintaining a 3.3x LTV:CAC

experiences.title: Member, Revenue Collective
experiences.jobDescription: A collection of top sales execs and operators that convene to discuss growing great companies.

experiences.title: Vice President - GTM Strategy and Enablement
experiences.jobDescription:
Tasked with building a repeatable and scalable revenue engine for ForeSee.   Redefined how ForeSee hires, trains, enables and measures the world wide sales organization to drive pipeline growth, higher ASP, faster deal cycles and more effective sales execution.

I left in December 2016 to accept a role with Litmus to build and scale a sales organization.

experiences.title: Area Vice President, TED - Talent, Education and Development
experiences.jobDescription: I was charged with building and scaling our worldwide sales enablement organization with a focus on both onboarding new reps and managers and up leveling the skills and talents of our tenured team.  Our programs and initiatives spanned systems excellence, sales process and methodology, sales skills and best practices, corporate messaging and delivery, vertical messaging and domain and vertical expertise. Ultimately, my organization redefined how we trained and  enabled our world wide sales organization by driving pipeline growth, faster deal cycles and more effective sales execution.

experiences.title: Vice President, Account Management (Services and Software) and Business Development
experiences.jobDescription:
I led the Account Management Organization (AMO) for the Services and Software verticals.  This team is responsible for managing all of our customer relationships, renewing clients, and selling additional services.  Additionally, the AMO team is responsible for customer relationships across all accounts in the vertical with a focus on increased customer satisfaction and loyalty.

In addition, in 2012 we launched a Business Development Program, which was focused on hiring recent college graduates.  This program had dual goals of hiring, training and retaining the next NetSuite super star sales person and accelerating lead generation and qualification for our sales verticals.

Club qualifier in 2010, 2011 and 2012.  AMO Worldwide Manager of the Year in 2010.

experiences.title: Vice President, Client Management
experiences.jobDescription:
OpenAir was acquired by NetSuite (NYSE: N, which was later acquired by Oracle (NYSE: ORCL)) in May 2008.

Promoted to build a client management and customer support team while maintaining my marketing role.  Managed innovative customer success team focused on generating business value for OpenAir customers.  Led programs to improve customer success through world class day-to-day technical support, ongoing OpenAir training and active account management. Responsible for customer relationships across all accounts with a focus on increased customer satisfaction and loyalty. Continued to lead all marketing and customer activities, including our annual user summit and local user events.

experiences.title: Director, Marketing
experiences.jobDescription: Recruited from Bain to lead all marketing and lead generation activities for a growing SaaS start up (before SaaS was a thing), including PPC, SEO and direct marketing campaigns. Also managed all customer marketing activities, including our annual User Summit and local user groups.

experiences.title: Consultant/Case Team Leader
experiences.jobDescription: Worked first as a summer Consultant in Chicago and then full time after business school as a consultant and case team leader on the west coast in the LA and SF offices and later on the east coast in the Boston office. Led teams to diagnose problems, conduct analyses, develop recommendations and implement solutions for clients across various industries, including consumer products, financial services, healthcare, automotive and private equity.  Basically I built a lot of spreadsheets and powerpoint presentations.  Amazing opportunity where I was surrounded by some of the brightest people around. I left before the manager promotion window to pursue an opportunity with a start up (OpenAir).

experiences.title: Manager
experiences.jobDescription: Leveraged my experience at AT&T to work in the burgeoning "Internet" group at American Express (note: this was during the day of dial up and before most people had mobile phones). Developed economic models for numerous interactive initiatives, including C2C payments and online wallets. Valued acquisition candidates for venture capital fund resulting in more than $10 million in investments.  Directed planning and budgeting totaling over $270 million in investments. Worked with a lot of very smart people in a great company culture. Left after two years to pursue an MBA at Kellogg.

experiences.title: Associate Manager
experiences.jobDescription: Awesome first job out of college. Financial Leadership Program - 2 year training program, rotating jobs every six months + weekly graduate level classes in accounting and finance. Awarded an overseas rotation in Brussels, Belgium. Made a lot of great friends and built a solid network.

experiences.title: A variety of roles
experiences.jobDescription:
I worked in a variety of roles over my summers during high school and college to earn money, including:
- bagging groceries at Albertson's
- order taker at Wendy's
- delivering Chinese food
- one day working for a moving company in the heat of Texas summer
- warehouse worker, filling orders and driving a forkflift
- customer service for a manufacturing company for two summers
- host and busboy at a Mexican restaurant
experiences.jobLocation: Dallas, Texas and West Palm Beach, Florida

I volunteered in several capacities in coaching soccer, softball and baseball teams across first-fourth grades for my son and daughter.

recommendationsReceived.name: Jessica A.
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: - Consulting Practice Director - NetSuite Services Industry Vertical
recommendationsReceived.context: Jessica reported directly to Brian
recommendationsReceived.description: It was a pleasure to work for Brian.  I reported to him directly and he was an excellent leader and mentor.  I say leader because Brian transcended being a manager - he inspired his employees, made us feel like we were working toward the greater good of our team and the organization, and created a strong sense of trust.  He was always available to advise and assist while giving his employees room to develop their capabilities.  I enthusiastically recommend Brian and would be thrilled to work with him again.

recommendationsReceived.name: Keith McInish
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Retired!
recommendationsReceived.context: Keith was Brian's client
recommendationsReceived.description: Brian is a high-energy results-oriented guy. His creativity and passion are assets that have proven valuable not only for his own company, but also for their customers (such as me). He has a transformative affect on the people around him, as well as the organization as a whole.

recommendationsReceived.name: Morris Panner
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Leading innovation in cloud imaging
recommendationsReceived.context: Morris managed Brian directly
recommendationsReceived.description: Brian did an outstanding job managing our client focused departments. He is fantastic working with clients, communicating clearly and developing deep bonds of trust. He also did a wonderful job recruiting and building a team. He single handedly created a recruiting and training system that was critical to our company's success.

recommendationsReceived.name: Tiago D.
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Entrepreneur | Ops, Growth & Product Advisor | Investor I @ARB Interactive I @HyperDigitalPartners | @Publishers Clearing House
recommendationsReceived.context: Tiago reported directly to Brian
recommendationsReceived.description:
I had the pleasure of working for Brian for 2 years directly out of school. More than a manager, Brian quickly became a trusted friend. He excelled in developing the company’s junior hires by promoting constructive discussions and empowering us to have an immediate impact in the company’s growth, and sees great pride in the personal success of all the ones he mentored.
More importantly, he mastered this basic principle that you can only succeed if you make others around you succeed and applied it directly to OpenAir’s vision, transforming the organization into a truly customer-centric place, a rare find in the tech industry. Brian’s efforts in leading the Client Management/Support and Marketing teams were key for Openair's global expansion and acquisition.

recommendationsReceived.name: Ronn Breaux
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Building Efficiencies through Software | Professional Services Automation | OpenAir Expert | NetSuite Solutions Provider | New Orleans Native | Pres. & CEO of Top Step LLC | Problem Solver
recommendationsReceived.context: Ronn was Brian's client
recommendationsReceived.description: It is rare in today's business climate to work with someone with such high integrity and customer service dedication.  Brian taught me the lessons of providing exemplary customer service which I use today within my business.  I owe Brian a huge debt of gratitude for his support over the years.

recommendationsReceived.name: Tom Brennan
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: CFO / COO | SaaS Executive | Raising Capital & Scaling | Driving Profitability | Successful Exits
recommendationsReceived.context: Tom was senior to Brian but didn't manage Brian directly
recommendationsReceived.description: Brian did a tremendous job envisioning, building and leading the Client Management team at OpenAir. His vision and follow-through were exemplary, ensuring that we had a customer base willing to advocate for our company, and giving us a firm foundation upon which we were able to execute rapid, profitable growth.

recommendationsReceived.name: Amy Auriemma
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Decorated US Navy Veteran - Sales and Marketing Operations Leader - Problem Solver - #ALLY
recommendationsReceived.context: Amy worked with Brian but they were at different companies
recommendationsReceived.description: Brian is a results oriented and consientious account manager.  He has always provided the highest level of support and attention to our account, our requests, our enhancement requests, and our relationship.  I have been a loyal OpenAir customer for many years, and the service I receive from the people at OpenAir (and Brian in particular as the leader of most of that effort) is the primary reason.  I am always confident that he will promptly and intuitively be able to address any problem or concern I may have, and I trust that he will work dilligently to address it.  It is always a pleasure doing business with him.

recommendationsReceived.name: Joe Longo
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Software Specialist/Volunteer/Cyclist
recommendationsReceived.context: Joe worked with Brian but they were at different companies
recommendationsReceived.description: Brian is professional, responsive and overall great to work with. He's typical of the culture at OpenAir and in many ways he influenced and developed their "customer-first" culture. They have a great product thanks in large part to Brian's years of dedication.

recommendations.name: Tyler Burkholder
recommendations.subtitle: Account Executive
recommendations.context: Brian was senior to Tyler but didn't manage Tyler directly
recommendations.description: Tyler started with Litmus as a BDR and embodied the phrase “competitively collaborative.” He was the top BDR most months but never failed to help and support his teammates. His approach did not change after be was promoted to the AE role. Tyler brings a tireless work ethic to his job but is also extremely coachable. I would gladly work with Tyler again.

recommendations.name: Michael Shoer
recommendations.subtitle: Revenue Enablement Leader | Aligning GTM Teams with Business Objectives through Training, Program and Content Creation | Collaborator
recommendations.context: Brian managed Michael directly
recommendations.description: Mike is the best enablement leader with whom I have worked. What makes Mike great is that he has a wealth of real world sales experience as a BDR, AE and sales leader and now is bringing that experience to sales enablement. I cannot recommend Mike enough and would gladly work with Mike again.

recommendations.name: Sam Nichols
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Account Executive at Higharc
recommendations.context: Brian managed Sam directly
recommendations.description: I have had the pleasure of working with Sam for the past seven years. Sam was our first rep here at Litmus back in 2016 as we were building our Direct model and GTM strategy. Sam excelled in this environment, working independently and demonstrating extreme scrappiness as we scaled our business. Sam was a top rep year after year while also working with sales leadership to pilot different GTM motions.  For the past few years, Sam has been supporting our partnership model, which built off of his prior sales experience at Litmus (and other companies). I highly recommend Sam for a role in a scaling, growing company in either a sales or partnership capacity.

recommendations.name: Reza Zaidi
recommendations.subtitle: Strategic Retail @ David
recommendations.description: I met Reza while lecturing at UVa and have kept in touch with him since. Reza is a very resilient and persistent individual who works to find solutions and truly enjoys engaging on challenging problems.  He also is very curious and is not afraid to ask questions, which reflects his confidence in what he knows and, more importantly, does not know. These qualities coupled with his general drive and goal orientation make him a great candidate for a role in Management Consulting.

recommendations.name: Ria Kharosekar
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Research Analyst at The Brattle Group
recommendations.context: Brian was Ria's teacher
recommendations.description: Ria is one of the most interesting people I have had the opportunity to meet in a long while. I first met Ria when I guest lectured recently at UVA in Professor Boichuk's marketing class. What impressed me most about Ria is her capacity to problem solve using her strong analytical and quantitative skills coupled with her innate ability to work in teams and collaborate with peers. She is both creative and methodical, which is a rare combination. On top of all of that, she is incredibly humble. I highly recommend Ria for an internship or full time role in many different capacities as she would be a terrific addition to any team and company.  Please contact me directly if you have any questions.

recommendations.name: Josh Fong
recommendations.subtitle: Growth Equity Investor at Goldman Sachs
recommendations.context: Brian was Josh's teacher
recommendations.description: Josh and I met when I guest lectured recently at UVA in Professor Boichuk's marketing class. I was immediately impressed with his strong business acumen and drive. As a student athlete and captain of the UVA men's swim team, Josh balances a heavy course load through the McIntire school and his swim team requirements. However, what impressed me more was his ability to ask great questions to truly understand issues and problems while also leveraging a keen analytical approach. I cannot recommend Josh enough for an internship or full time role in investment banking, private equity or venture capital. Please contact me directly if you have any questions.

recommendations.name: Vivian Chen
recommendations.subtitle: Fulbright ETA to the Czech Republic | UVA McIntire Alum
recommendations.context: Brian was Vivian's teacher
recommendations.description: I had the pleasure of meeting Vivian during my time at UVa when I recently guest lectured during Professor Boichuk's marketing class. Vivian was a great and engaged contributor during class. As I have gotten to know her better since then, I have been impressed with her desire to leverage her business degree to work in an industry where she can create emotional connections between the brand and the consumer while also impacting the world around her through, for example, sustainability and income equality initiatives.  I highly recommend her for an internship or full time role in brand management or marketing.  Please ping me directly if you have any questions.

recommendations.name: Eva Parios
recommendations.subtitle: Brand Strategy Associate at Prophet
recommendations.description: I met Eva while guest lecturing during a Professor Boichuk's Marketing class at the McIntire School of Commerce at UVa. She was a very engaged participant in class and in fact volunteered to do a role play with me in front of the whole class. As I have gotten to know Eva, I have been impressed with her attention to detail and her passion for marketing, specifically to consumers. She is a doer who thinks ahead, is reliable and looks for problems, not just solutions. If you are looking for an intern this summer at a CPG company, I cannot recommend Eva enough.

recommendations.name: Ryan Grace
recommendations.subtitle: CRO, eCommerce, Payments, Compliance
recommendations.context: Brian reported directly to Ryan
recommendations.description: I spent a little less than a year working for Ryan and enjoyed every minute. Ryan is a great sales leader and overall great person. He knows what it takes to scale and run a global sales force.  I recommend to anyone looking to be challenged and developed to seek out an opportunity working for him.

recommendations.name: John C.

recommendations.context: Brian was senior to John but didn't manage John directly

John already was well known at NetSuite as the go-to-person for all questions about our sales process, where to find content, how to use the CRM and how to get a deal done. He was a natural choice to join our growing sales enablement team.  John played a critical role in building our first phase of the sales enablement and general on-boarding program and was instrumental in getting reps up to speed and selling.

recommendations.subtitle: Senior Marketing and Communications Manager @The Linux Foundation | OpenSSF | OpenSearch | O-RAN Software Community | Alpha-Omega
recommendations.context: Brian managed Sally directly
recommendations.description: Sally did a great job supporting our west coast based clients.  She came on board and was able to learn our product and process while working remotely from the rest of the organization.  She consistently performed in her job.  As a result, I highly recommend her for a similar role.

recommendations.name: Shawn Green
recommendations.subtitle: Chief Revenue Officer EVP GTM Carbon6 & ex-industry leaders NetSuite, BlackLine & Mavenlink | PE Advisor | LP VC | Startup/VC (Series A/B/C)
recommendations.context: Brian managed Shawn directly
recommendations.description: Shawn is a total rock star.  He is one of the best natural sales reps that I have encountered at NetSuite or anywhere.  He is driven, passionate and great with his customers. I wish I had a 1,000 reps like Shawn.

recommendations.name: Amy Auriemma
recommendations.subtitle: Decorated US Navy Veteran - Sales and Marketing Operations Leader - Problem Solver - #ALLY
recommendations.context: Amy was Brian's client
recommendations.description: I have worked with Amy for the past several years and have great respect for her as a driven, passionate and hard-working business partner. She has a strong nose for business coupled with a great personality.  I have nothing but great things to say about her.

recommendations.name: Jessica A.
recommendations.subtitle: - Consulting Practice Director - NetSuite Services Industry Vertical
recommendations.context: Brian managed Jessica directly
recommendations.description:
I highly recommend Jessica.  From 2006 to 2009, she worked for me in OpenAir’s client management group managing many of our key, strategic accounts.  While she possesses numerous skills and attributes that have made her successful throughout her career, I believe her number one asset is her sheer horsepower and intelligence.  Jessica is bright, articulate and analytical.  She is adept at understanding and dissecting critical client issues into smaller, core problems and then working with the appropriate internal resources to address the concerns.   But Jessica is not all brains. She has strong relationship management skills, allowing her to work successfully with diverse groups of people, from engineers and sales people internally to all levels of personnel at our clients, including C-level executives.  

If I were in the capacity to work with Jessica in the future or hire her into another company, I would so without hesitation and with great enthusiasm.

recommendations.name: Spectra Adaora Ijeoma Asala
recommendations.subtitle: Maverick CPO/COO—platform product, GTM strategy & emerging tech | Purpose-driven venture builder & impact investor | Building a life and portfolio career of meaning.
recommendations.context: Brian was senior to Spectra Adaora Ijeoma but didn't manage Spectra Adaora Ijeoma directly
recommendations.description: I had the pleasure of working with Adaora when she was an Account Executive at OpenAir.  I recommend her very highly to anyone looking for a smart, passionate team member who can wear many hats while having an immediate impact on the bottom line.  When I first interviewed Adaora, her raw intelligence was very clear, but what most impressed me was her humility and humor, which as everyone knows cannot be taught and are critical to success in business and in life.  I gladly would work with Adaora again.

recommendations.name: Ronn Breaux
recommendations.subtitle: Building Efficiencies through Software | Professional Services Automation | OpenAir Expert | NetSuite Solutions Provider | New Orleans Native | Pres. & CEO of Top Step LLC | Problem Solver
recommendations.context: Brian worked with Ronn but they were at different companies
recommendations.description: Ronn is a rock star. I worked with him when he was at DCC Services and have nothing but great things to say about him. He is driven, bright and energetic.  Most importantly, I learned a lot working with Ronn. He made me better at my job and taught me to "search for problems, not answers", which is something that I teach today to the people that work for me.

headline: Partner and Americas Utilities & Renewables Practice Leader at Bain & Company
about:
Martha is the leader of Bain's Utilities & Renewables Practice in the Americas and is a Partner in the Toronto office. She is also a leader in the firm's Energy and Natural Resources (ENR) practice.

Martha advises leading electric and gas utilities across North America on large-scale transformations—modernizing power and gas distribution networks, delivering a next-generation customer experience, and navigating the strategy, regulatory, operational, and engineering shifts required deliver growth. Her work also spans cost improvement, organizational design, and change management. Martha also has significant experience working with Bain's private equity clients on energy topics. 

Beyond the energy sector, Martha also leads work with Bain's non-profit clients in Canada, including a focus on leading Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion efforts. 

Prior to Bain, Martha worked as a professional engineer in power system planning and engineering design. She holds an MBA from the University of Toronto’s Rotman School of Management and a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from the University of New Brunswick.

headline: Author/Flâneur
about:
Author and former energy industry executive. Experience includes 27+ years in the oil & gas industry (22 years of which with Shell), with positions held in North America, Africa, Europe, the UK and Asia. Experience in the energy industry includes leadership in M&A, Joint Venture formation, strategic sourcing/procurement, technology licensing & commercialization, government relations, corporate strategy/planning & economics, and P&L mgmt + Board-level experience in a technology  firm.
US Army/82nd Airborne veteran.

experiences.title: GM, Strategic Sourcing Development
experiences.jobDescription: Based in Shanghai, Andrew led a business function across China, India, Mexico, Russia & Korea and was responsible for delivering and growing Shell's (upstream & downstream) Strategic Sourcing Development activities. These activities included the identification, qualification & Supplier Management of Socially & Environmentally Responsible suppliers in Emerging Countries of equipment, materials & services utilised globally by the Shell Group. Andrew was also Shell's LSCPR (Local Senior CP Representative) for China, with responsibility for leading the capability development of the Contracting & Procurement function in China.

experiences.title: Acquisitions & Divestments Manager-Europe
experiences.jobDescription: Based in the UK, managed a team of A&D professionals in the UK & Norway that executed acquisition, divestment and swap activity involving Shell's upstream assets across the UK & Continental Europe. Individual deals ranged to US$1bln+ and included operated & non-operated assets, producing & exploration assets, and deals where Shell led transactions for a consortium of licence partners. Counterparties included traditional E&Ps, major Utilities, Japanese conglomerates and hybrid private equity & sovereign wealth fund-backed entities.

headline: Global Treasurer, EVP at Bain & Company | Finance Executive | People and Inclusivity Champion  | Board Member
about:
Highly motivated and results oriented corporate finance professional with over 30 years of diversified experience. Proven ability to build relationships across a wide spectrum of constituents.  Skilled at developing and presenting complex proposals to executive and board levels. Adept at training and developing staff.

Specialties include Capital Markets, Hedging, Global Cash Management, Liquidity Management, M&A Due Diligence and Financing, Training and Development, Cross-functional Teaming, International Collaboration, DEI Leadership, Mentoring, Effective Communication and Presentation.

experiences.title: Acting Corporate Treasurer
experiences.jobDescription:
Enabled the achievement of key corporate objectives by being a trusted advisor to the executive team, (especially to the CFO); developed and led a strong treasury team with global expertise and functional acumen. Key roles included capital structure development, exposure risk management, M&A financing and due diligence, global cash management and repatriation, and pension asset management.

Coordinated the review and development of formal capital structure encompassing strategic financing, share buyback, and dividend policy.

Led several pension de-risking projects (LDI, lump sum offer) for a $200M pension plan that reduced risk and curtailed cash outflows.

Facilitated senior management’s strategic decision-making through the development and presentation of white papers and recommendations in areas such as capital structure, pension de-risking and insurance risk management.

Oversaw annual $75M tax efficient global cash repatriation program across Asia, Europe and the USA.

Expanded team strength and capabilities by training and developing staff in exposure management, financial modeling, global cash repatriation, cross functional teaming and problem solving.

experiences.title: Senior Manager, Treasury
experiences.jobDescription:
Ownership of global corporate treasury operations, lead/support strategic initiatives in exposure management (currencies, interest rate, commodities), hedge accounting assessment and compliance, M&A financing, capital structure management, global cash planning, pension asset/liability management and insurance risk management.

Led negotiations of a $265M credit revolver/term loan structure that funded a major international acquisition.

Managed over $200M of global corporate cash investments within the framework of safety, liquidity, diversification and visibility.

Developed robust hedging policy and implemented effective cash flow and balance sheet  hedges with annual notional of $100M across several risk classes including interest rates, commodities and currencies, while securing hedge accounting treatment where possible.

Coached and developed staff in key areas such as multi risk hedging, hedge accounting fundamentals, pension asset administration, global cash forecasting, senior management communication, and cross functional teaming and problem solving.

Negotiated and supervised the implementation of two cash management platforms in Europe and the USA, to deliver improved services within desired timeframe.

experiences.title: Treasury Manager
experiences.jobDescription: Managed global treasury function with key responsibility for currency risk management, cash management, global investments, insurance administration and treasury policy development.

experiences.title: Treasury Supervisor
experiences.jobDescription:
Led the treasury team in key roles such as global cash forecasting, currency hedging, insurance risk management and cash management and investing. Key partner to worldwide colleagues in applying global treasury policies and managing banking and insurance relationships.

Developed and implemented global cash management policy for over 50 worldwide offices.

Led $500 million hedge program and minimized foreign exchange P&L impact by millions per year. 

Key team member in establishing and running European In-house bank.

experiences.title: Senior/Lead Treasury Analyst
experiences.jobDescription: Progressive responsibilities for global cash forecasting, currency hedging, cash management and drafting of several global treasury policies.

educations.description: Concentration in international taxation, including transfer pricing, source of income and tax treaties.

recommendationsReceived.name: Garnet Gibson
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Finance Leader
recommendationsReceived.description:
Easton's ethics and wholesome quality make him a good friend and a strong professional. He is a brilliant thinker with an uncanny ability to see things that others would likely miss, and to ensure that the focus is always on the things that matters most. 

A serious intellectual, with a strong knowledge of cash management and financial and investment matters, Easton would be an asset to any organization. 

As a friend, Easton is invaluable when discussing sports, politics and world affairs topics. His penetrating views bring interesting perspective to all topics, whether it's a discussion on the intricacies of a goal in the latest soccer game, or the impact of the financial challenges in Greece on the fortunes of Wall Street investors. Easton is a quality individual and a good friend.

recommendationsReceived.name: Lenka Marusak
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Treasury Director
recommendationsReceived.context: Lenka reported directly to Easton
recommendationsReceived.description:
Easton is a well seasoned Treasury professional and an amazing mentor. He is able to translate complicated ideas into easily understandable concepts.
One of Easton’s strengths is International treasury - not only does he have strong analytical skills that make him very successful at foreign exchange management and hedging but also has great relationship management skills.
Colleagues from different geographies enjoyed working with him because of his great attitude and openness to new ideas. Easton’s strong work ethic coupled with people skills make him a great asset to any company.

recommendationsReceived.name: Ann Malinowski
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Strategic CFO with Focus on Execution and Value Creation
recommendationsReceived.context: Ann managed Easton directly
recommendationsReceived.description: It’s my great pleasure to recommend Easton’s work at the Boston Consulting Group.  Easton supervised treasury operations including cash management, foreign exchange trading, investments and insurance on a global basis reporting to me.  He impressed me with his passion for treasury management and his enthusiasm for learning and growth.  Easton produced high quality work in a responsive manner.  In a very short amount of time Easton had build great working relationships with the finance staff at the company as well as numerous service providers.  People enjoyed working with him because of his positive attitude and service orientation.  I would hire Easton again if the opportunity were to present itself.

recommendations.name: Ronald Pelletier, CPA, MBA
recommendations.subtitle: Chief Financial Officer at Esler Companies
recommendations.context: Easton worked with Ronald but on different teams
recommendations.description:
I was fortunate to have Ron as an invaluable business partner during our seven years together at Rogers Corporation.  He is a highly qualified corporate finance executive with deep expertise in global financial management, M&A due diligence and integration, SEC reporting and personnel management.  Importantly, Ron possesses excellent interpersonal relations skills, and is adept at communicating effectively across cultures as well as with the board of directors and investors.

Ron teams well with others.  I observed him on several occasions interacting successfully with teams as disparate as subsidiary finance teams, external auditors, cross-functional project teams and M&A due diligence teams.  Crucially, he was instrumental to my own successful integration at Rogers, proactively helping me to learn the ropes.

He is technically sound, with an admirable grasp of technical accounting issues such as derivative accounting, pension accounting and purchase price accounting.

There is no doubt that he possesses excellent executive credentials.  He presented to the board of directors on a regular basis and earned their trust and respect.  He was also the company’s representative in dealing with partners and senior managers of various audit and advisory firms, and was consistently skilled at articulating and advocating for the company’s operational and strategic objectives.

Ron is a true professional and was a gifted ambassador for our company.  Refreshingly, he also possessed a positive life outlook and a wonderful sense of humor.  The greatest praise I can give to him is to declare that I would enjoy working with him again if the opportunity arises.

recommendations.name: Marci McCormack
recommendations.subtitle: Founder at Executive Group Travel
recommendations.context: Easton worked with Marci but they were at different companies
recommendations.description:
I am privileged to count Marci as a friend and business colleague.  We met almost 10 years ago when she was a summer intern, and over time in my role as an FX risk management customer has observed her tremendous growth in becoming a fully-fledged professional with enviable credentials in financial products knowledge, marketing, sales and customer service. She has successfully combined strong work ethic, desire for new learning, customer focus and instinctive business savvy to deliver solid value for her company and customers.

In spite of her achievements she is humble enough to recognize the value of insight, and has surrounded herself with mentors who are able to strengthen and enrich her personal development objectives.  Importantly, she is a well-rounded individual. In addition to work commitments she devotes generous amounts of time to family and friends, charitable work and world travel.

recommendations.subtitle: Uber Driver 🙂 Grandad (x4!)

recommendations.description: I’ve had the pleasure of working with Geoff for over 2 years now.  He has consistently impressed me with his knowledge of the FX markets, and his willingness to recommend strategies that address my particular needs.  My company benefits regularly from the extensive insight and experience he brings from his tenure at some of the best global financial institutions.  He’s a trusted and highly valued business partner, but I am also grateful for the fact that he possesses an engaging, humorous spirit that delivers an excellent blend of high quality professional and personal interaction.

headline: Vice President @ Bain & Company | Global Knowledge Management Platforms
about:
As a Vice President at Bain & Company, I lead the global technology strategy for the next generation knowledge platform and the generative AI enterprise chatbot. These initiatives aim to enhance the value proposition of our management consulting services by enabling our consultants to access, share, and leverage our global expertise and insights. 

With over 20 years of IT leadership experience in financial services and professional services, I have a proven track record of delivering large scale technology products that support business objectives and enhance customer experience. I have experience in all areas of IT, from desktop support management to infrastructure to application development. I have built and managed high performing business services and technology teams, aligned IT strategy and planning with business priorities, and managed complex change initiatives. I am passionate about using technology to drive innovation, collaboration, and growth.

experiences.title: Vice President
experiences.jobDescription:
As a leader in Bain & Company’s Knowledge and Innovation ecosystem, I drive the development of cutting-edge, AI-native tools and platforms that enable our consultants to deliver exceptional client impact. My work centers on designing and managing the full lifecycle of Bain’s next-generation knowledge platform—from early innovation through build and ongoing operations—delivering a significant competitive advantage for the firm.

Led the strategic program to build Bain's internal knowledge management platform, Iris.  Led the development of Bain's first generative AI chatbot, Sage.

I partner closely with Bain case teams and clients to solve complex business challenges through thoughtful knowledge management strategies and contribute to strategic proposals. I partner with our practices to create and execute content strategies for Bain’s proprietary intellectual property (IP), ensuring it is structured, accessible, and leveraged at scale.

My role also involves optimizing and automating core business processes using AI, building intelligent tools that streamline consultants’ workflows and enhance decision-making. I manage both internal and external delivery teams across onshore and offshore locations, aligning cross-functional efforts to bring high-impact solutions to life.

At the intersection of technology, strategy, and operations, I champion knowledge as an asset and deliver scalable innovations that power Bain’s differentiated client service.

This experience led me back to Franklin when I wanted to hire an executive coach to help me think about next steps in my career.  Franklin helped me crystalize my career goals, how to achieve them and think through the trade-offs of different decisions.  Since he frequently deals with senior level people, he was able to bring a deep level of insight into the process and I felt comfortable talking with him.

I would highly recommend Franklin for either group training needs or individual one on one coaching.

experiences.title: Manager, Regional Sales-Northeast Region
experiences.jobDescription:
Responsible for leading key members of sales team that market and sell enterprise software products and consulting services to C-level executive decision makers of multi-national companies. Responsible for $1.5M of new revenue generation and $3.0M of client retention for the Northeast Region. Consistently exceed annual quota and client retention over 100% of designed plan since 2007. Perform full sales cycle from initial customer identification, account penetration, customized sales presentations, design statement of work, negotiate complex contracts and closing opportunities with VP and C-Level executives in the finance and tax department. Workded in tandem with senior executive global strategy group on market landscape & size, competitor insights, current and future customer needs and value proposition development designed to increase annual sales and market share.

Key Achievements
▪ Increased New Sales Revenue 160% and Territory Value of 125% in Four Years as Senior Regional Sales Manager. 
▪ Achieved Presidents Club Honors for 2009 and 2010. Ranked 1st out of 15 Regional Sales Managers based on new sales and client retention for 2009 and 2010. Consistently Ranked in top 25% of 1000 Sales Executives, globally since 2007.  
▪ Successfully secured the largest software and consulting service project in 2010. Worked diligently in presenting benefits of our software consulting services to C-evel audience, securing a $750,000 three-year engagement.
▪ Personally secured key accounts with Pepsi, Polo Ralph Lauren, Warnaco, MassMutal, Cushman Wakefield, ING, Pitney Bowes, Weight Watchers, UBS and over 150 other key accounts through combination of aggressive penetration activities, client needs assessments, relationship building and  negotiation skills with VP and C-Level decision makers.
▪ Promoted in 2007 from Business Development Manager to Regional Sales Manager, which includes responsibility for two in direct sales reports for the Northeast Region.

experiences.title: National Account Executive

Responsible for developing new business selling a portfolio of wireless products to Mid-Market & Large Corporations, including Fortune 1000 market. Worked directly with VP and C-Level executives on identifying needs for wireless data solutions with the result of more effective and secure ways to communicate; both internally and externally.  Responsible for taking prospects thru the entire sales cycle. Presenting products/solutions to gain approval, participate in the technical development and delivery of the clients needs, negotiate and structure long term contracts and the development of strategic roll out plans, globally. Extensive travel nationally to key accounts with the goal of identifying new sales opportunities across all business units, building long term relationships and client retention. Helped launch sales efforts as the 1st company in U.S. to market Research In Motion (Blackberry) into Fortune 1000 Companies, Investment Banks, Top Law Firms and Accounting Firms.

Key Achievements
▪	Lead New York National Account Sales team (1999-2004) consistently over 190% of annual target. 
▪	Attained Circle of Excellence/Presidents Club (Four Time Recipient).
▪	Shattered Company Record for new and upsell opportunities in second year with an increase of 140% over previous record.
▪	Recognized in top 10% of sales in North America from 1999 thru 2004 with $1.5M annually in new revenue through utilization of highly consultative sales approach.  Extensively involved in pre and post sales implementation and client retention. 
▪	Expanded market share and reach to target accounts with the launch of Research In Motion (RIM). Secured top investment banks, accounting and law firms, despite the challenges of selling new product/solution into corporate market space. 
▪	Excelled in building long term relationships with VP and C-Level executives in the Information Technology department of Mid-Market & Large Corporations, including Fortune 1000 market.

Charged with selling a broad range of customized server, storage and cluster solutions thru cutting edge technology. Maintained a 12-month rolling forecast in excess of assigned quota. Responsible for research and recommending lead sales campaigns to increase product market penetration.

Key Achievements

recommendations.name: Fred Fried
recommendations.subtitle: Sales Leadership - Former Box, SalesLoft and MongoDB
recommendations.context: Daniel reported directly to Fred
recommendations.description: I’ve had the pleasure of working with Fred Fried for six years at Thomson Reuters, three as his colleague and reporting directly to him for the last three years. As a sales professional, working with Fred was one of the best experiences I’ve had in my tenure at Thomson Reuters. Fred played a key role in the development of my career as a leading sales executive, together we closed some of the largest sales in company history.  He was also an invaluable asset to growth of the company, under his direction we exceeded revenue targets year over year, even during the most challenging economic times in recent history.  In addition, Fred was instrumental in implementing numerous changes to our company that positively impacted the future of our business.  Fred was a leader in every position he held at Thomson Reuters, he earned great respect from his peers in the organization and his direct reports all gained valuable skills that lead to exceeding their yearly goals. For all of these reasons and more, I would personally recommend my former colleague and friend as a valued asset to any organization looking for a senior executive in their sales management team.

updates.postText:
So much energy last week in London for Stratos Academy 2024. Thrilled to have (finally!) gotten together in-person with this group; many of whom have been working so hard on this initiative since its inception & launch in 2022! 

Stratos is Bain & Company’s bold initiative for female leaders in financial services—bringing CxOs across the industry together to discover shared ambitions, develop strong networks, and to champion the next generation of female leaders. 

It’s been inspirational to be a part of it, with this group of incredible ladies, led by the vision of Nishma Gosrani OBE.

Marialara Visini De Murtas, Jasmin Myton, Charlotte Bygraves, Milly Sheehan, Sarah Hamlyn, Katie Morley

headline: Partner at Bain & Company
about:
Simo Zerrifi is a core member of Bain’s Financial Services and Enterprise Technology practices.

He works with major banking and insurance companies across North America and EMEA to drive product and operational transformations and deliver sustainable business value through technology, data, and AI. Simo’s expertise includes technology strategy, Data & AI, product-centric operating model transformation, tech modernization, and performance improvement.

Prior to joining Bain, Simo worked at Gartner in NYC and Kurt Salmon Associates in both Paris and New York City. He earned his MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business, graduating with high distinction as a Wallman Scholar, and holds a Master of Engineering degree from Telecom ParisTech in France.

publications.title: Mind the Gap - Crafting a Business-Centric IT Skills Strategy
publications.summary:
Business leaders routinely invest significant resources to develop and deliver ambitious business plans, taking time and great care to work through the strategic, operational and financial details. But the essential contribution of key people, and hence skills, to the successful implementation of the strategy is often neglected. Consequently, a damaging imbalance emerges between growth targets and the core capabilities required to achieve those goals.

This disconnect has become exacerbated in recent years. As IT becomes a more critical enabler of business today, many IT organizations have failed to adopt a comprehensive human capital strategy. While much focus has been placed on systems, technical capabilities and IT assets, ensuring that the organization has the proper talent in place and is equipped with the right skills to align with and drive the evolving business capabilities of the enterprise has typically taken a back seat.

Although the effects are not always immediately obvious, experience has shown that the inability to predict key skills requirements and ensure that the right talent is in place when and where needed undermines business performance in the long term. The results are missed growth targets, mediocre productivity and higher recruiting costs.

publications.title: How to make your target operating model a reality?
publications.summary:
Whether facing the challenges of austerity measures and regulatory changes, an increasingly dynamic and globalized business environment, or the difficulties posed by an ever more complex digital and data-driven market, defining the right target operating model is crucial for steering the course to profitable growth. As an overall operations and technology ecosystem, a target operating model serves as a company’s blueprint for achieving its strategic vision.

Realizing the full benefits of a target operating model, however, and regularly adapting it to continually shifting business strategies, can pose significant challenges. No single, ideal target operating model exists. Rather, each company’s model design will depend on its starting point, culture and the optimization goals it has prioritized based on its business strategy, market position and areas of competition, and differentiated client value proposition.

publications.title: The Next Generation EPMO
publications.summary:
Today, most organizations are facing two major challenges: business uncertainty and an accelerated pace of change. They face adaptive challenges— global changes in societies, markets, customers, competition and technology—which are forcing them to clarify their values, develop new strategies and learn new ways of operating. In this uncertain environment, companies must execute on an increasingly complex stage. The ability to develop and implement new strategic initiatives and change gears rapidly is becoming a key differentiator and area of competitive advantage.

Yet many companies struggle to successfully execute on these strategic initiatives. The difficulty is blindly attributed to shortcomings in leadership, while, in reality, it is largely associated with ineffective engagement and management. Many senior executives struggle with getting the information they need—when they need it—to make the necessary adjustments and course corrections that are critical to ensuring that large strategic initiatives deliver their target impact.

Kurt Salmon has identified four pillars that shape the framework for the next-generation Enterprise PMO and which will improve the odds of successfully delivering strategic initiatives.

publications.title: Enterprise Integrated Planning: Air Traffic Control for CIOs
publications.summary:
For years, companies have been pouring money into resources, processes, and technologies that can help them manage risk.

Risk management involves a judicious mix of preventing the risks that can reasonably be controlled, learning to recognize the ones that can’t be prevented, being prepared to react to minimize damage, and having the resources to recover from the problems that do occur. Technology is an essential component to succeeding in today’s business environment and companies recognize that the complexities of technology require a commitment to the development of more robust capabilities to manage risk and create a more risk-aware culture. Industries with the highest dependency on technology are faced today with the competing requirements of providing a stable, reliable, low cost technology platform for daily business operations (“Run the Business”) and also providing a dynamic, flexible, cost effective capability to modify the technology platform in response to technology or business imperatives (“Change the Business”).

updates.postText:
Today, TechCrunch announced our $7.5M funding round to scale low-cost ammonia production. 

Breakthrough technologies don’t reach global impact alone. That’s why I’m  proud to welcome global energy leaders ALIAD (Air Liquide Venture Capital), Shell Ventures, MOL Switch LLC and Chevron Technology Ventures to our cap table, alongside the backing of our sharp financial partners Starlight Ventures, Collaborative Fund, AROSA CAPITAL MANAGEMENT, LP, Zero Infinity Partners, Katapult Ocean, Alumni Ventures and more

This milestone belongs to the Ammobia team: a deeply competent, committed crew I learn from every day. Tristan Gilbert Guido Radaelli Ian Kuhlenthal David Koshy Patrick B. Gibson Jay Roudebush Eric Jin Edward Hsieh Alan Engbrecht Fabio Zurcher Soham Kulkarni Cindy N.

What we’re building reshapes four industries at once—agriculture, maritime shipping, chemicals, and clean energy. Low-cost ammonia. Fueling the world.

Achieved together—with gratitude to everyone involved.

Now all hands on deck. 🚢 

Full article here: https://lnkd.in/g3i6tQme 

P.S And we are hiring, check links in comment 👇

🌊  Growing up as a sailor, I developed a deep passion for the ocean. That same passion led me to start Ammobia 25 years later — with a clear mission: to decarbonize hard-to-abate sectors like shipping with technologies that deliver both climate impact and positive ROI.

⚓  Just days ago, governments at the International Maritime Organization decided not to adopt its proposed Net Zero Framework — the world’s first global carbon pricing system for international maritime emissions. This is more than a missed policy vote. It’s a setback for collective climate action — and for the 3% of global GHG emissions that the maritime industry represents.

🟢 A few weeks ago, I stepped aboard Fortescue Green Pioneer (Thanks to Bennett Cohen & Yash Rane 🙏 ), an ammonia-fueled vessel proving that the technology works and crews can feel safe operating it. The future is here — it just needs the right incentives to scale. 

🛳️  Just like Fortescue, many other global shipping giants have been leading this transition: Mitsui O.S.K. Lines, Ltd., Yara International, CMB.TECH and more. Not just because they care about our planet, but because they know it is what it takes unlock long-term value and competitiveness.  

🚀 At Ammobia, we’re pushing boundaries every day to make ammonia affordable and accessible because the shipping industry deserves better options than waiting.

🆙  Progress may be delayed, but it’s far from over. Failure is not final.. it is the courage to continue that counts! Let’s keep sailing forward.

#decarbonization #shipping #ammonia #cleantech #energytransition #IMO

The hydrogen and ammonia hype is dead and that’s a good thing. Historically, many transformative energy technologies have followed the well-known Gartner Hype cycle from “hype” to “post-hype dip” to the “plateau of real impact”. This is the moment that matters — when perseverance, focus, and execution drive meaningful change. 

Now is the time to double down on cost-effective, scalable solutions that reduce both cost and carbon across fertilizers, energy, transportation, and chemicals.

That’s exactly why Tristan and I founded Ammobia three years ago — and why our entire team is more energized than ever to be building the future of ammonia.

Thank you to the World Economic Forum for the recognition and to Jennifer Schenker for telling our story and for shining light on all the great innovation in nitrogen and ammonia! 

Full article here: https://lnkd.in/gQq92Qur

Innovator post: https://lnkd.in/g3V4k82Y

📢📢  The Ammobia team is thrilled to announce its oversubscribed 4.2M$ seed financing to feed and fuel our decarbonized world with clean ammonia, as published by Axios this morning. 📢 📢 

The round was led by Starlight Ventures with participation of Collaborative Fund, Chevron Technology Ventures, Arosa Capital, Zero Infinity Partners, R7, DNX Ventures and Plug and Play Tech Center

With this funding round, Ammobia is advancing its technology through a 1000X scale-up, working towards a ground-breaking revolution in ammonia production 

We got here thanks to the indispensable support of remarkable individuals and organizations - our investors, early supporters and advisors 

👉 Full press release here: https://lnkd.in/ghWg2PTF
👉 This is just the beginning , follow us to stay tuned

headline: Founder | Strategy | Board Leader | Business Development | Business Transformation | Speaker | Create extraordinary growth
about:
Jeff Wuest is a business strategist and visionary, working with his team at SynFiny Advisors to help companies achieve extraordinary growth.    
 
Today’s business environment demands the right blend of innovation, strategy, and risk-taking in order to be successful.  Jeff works with leaders to push the boundaries of what they think is possible, so they can make big strategy bets without risking everything, and create an environment where growth is maximized.  His expertise includes strategic planning, rapid market expansion and operational scale-up.  
 
Jeff is an entrepreneur with experience mentoring startups and emerging companies, as well as being a strategic advisor to multi-billion-dollar corporations. He has over 30 years of experience developing game-changing strategies across different industries, categories, products and services.  His focus is helping forward-thinking leaders succeed with breakthrough strategy, execution and operations. 

Currently, Jeff Wuest is CEO of SynFiny Advisors, a global business consultancy firm, which was recognized by Inc Magazine’s, Inc. 5000, and ranked as one of the nation’s fastest-growing private companies for the past four years.  Prior to SynFiny Advisors, he spent 25 years as a finance executive for Procter & Gamble where he worked and lived around the globe while focusing on leadership roles which grew and transformed the business.

experiences.title: Chief Executive Officer - Global
experiences.jobDescription:
•Recruited a global team of partners and experts to improve our clients operational, organizational, and strategic objectives.
•Delivered +90% CAGR over the past seven years as we expanded into current and new clients, geographies, and practices.
•Delivering target financial and growth targets to the shareholders of the company.
•Led the global expansion into all regions of the globe.   
•Developed a marketing, web, and social media strategy to create a 1,500+ prospective and current client base.
•Created standard methodology and materials for use with our clients from large to small to give clients fast and visible improvement.
•Led SynFiny to become a 3x Inc. 5000 honoree – a recognition granted to only 1 in 8 companies.

experiences.title: Chief Executive Officer - International
experiences.jobDescription:
•Expanded services to 15 functional practices and built an organization of 250+ advisors and consultants.
•For the second year in a row, SynFiny Advisors made the prestigious Inc. 5000 list, Increased revenues to multi-million dollars with clients that include medium to large, multi-billion-dollar companies. 
•Developed rapid expansion Go-to-Market strategy and, within 6 years, opened international offices in Panama, Brazil, Colombia, Costa Rica, Mexico, Peru, Singapore, China, Dubai, and Russia.

experiences.title: Chief Executive Officer - North America
experiences.jobDescription:
•A Founder and Chief Strategist of SynFiny Advisors -- a fast growing, global consulting firm.
•Developed the vision and strategy to launch a NA consulting business challenging the existing consulting industry model.
•Lead business development and expansion strategy, and in less than 3 years, increased revenue 10x to over two million dollars.
•Expanded services to 18 functional practices and built an organization of 100+ advisors and consultants.

experiences.title: Board Chair
experiences.jobDescription:
I am currently serving as Board Chair of Outside the Bachs. I have been instrumental in shaping the company's strategic direction and fostering a culture of innovation. Guided by an unwavering vision, we are transforming the private teaching industry for musicians with cutting-edge solutions that address their key challenges.
 
As a visionary leader, working with two amazing founders in Kelly Riordan and Isak Peterson, I continuously challenge the status quo and encourage our team to think beyond boundaries. At Outside the Bachs, we believe in being pioneers, not followers. By anticipating market trends and disruptive technologies, we seize opportunities to stay ahead of the competition.
 
Outside the Bachs has experienced remarkable growth and expanded its market presence. We have secured strategic partnerships, enabling us to scale rapidly and find ways to better serve musicians who are business owners. My focus on data-driven strategies has empowered us to make well-informed decisions and capitalize on untapped opportunities.
 
Beyond my role at Outside the Bachs, I actively contribute to the entrepreneurial ecosystem as a thought leader and advocate. As a frequent speaker at industry events, member of Inc Masters, I share insights on emerging trends, leadership strategies, and fostering innovation. I also mentor aspiring entrepreneurs, empowering them with the knowledge and guidance to navigate the start-up landscape.

experiences.title: Finance Director - Global
experiences.jobDescription:
•As Director Global FP&A: Led more effective and efficient end-to-end business transformation for the world’s largest consumer products company. 
- Rolled out global standardization of work processes, organizational design, and tools across 3,000 users located in 80+ countries, improving FP&A productivity by 30%.
- Enabled a significant step change in F&A productivity of 30% (or ~250 roles).
- Delivered a global organization design enabling 35% of FP&A processes (~300 roles) to move to shared service centers located in Philippines, Costa Rica, UK, Russia, and China.
- Improved decision-making speed and identified $60M savings from indirect-media spend.
- Delivered year-on-year financial services savings of approximately $6M.

•As Director Global Banking: Oversaw cash management processes globally with scope of $84B in collections, ~$70B in payments, and included full intercompany transactions estimated at ~ $500B.
- Established Joint Business Plan with P&G’s three global banking partners.
- Led project team of 15 direct reports, 50 multi-functional, global teams. Responsible for $100M in project spending and direct oversight of SG&A budget of $225M.

experiences.title: Operational & Finance Leadership  – International
experiences.jobDescription:
•As CFO; led turn-around of the $45M loss making business in Central Asia, a key building block market in P&G’s developing market portfolio. 
- Turned around business to adequate AT margin within 18 months.
- Responsible for 30-person finance and accounting organization tasked with accurate profit forecasting, financial analysis, budgeting, GAAP/Statutory accounting, distributor financial support, and cash management. Implemented systems (Platinum, SAP, Excel) to provide strong business management and controls.

•As Finance Manager; managed JV investment program in Russia, one of P&G fastest growing regions. 
- Managed scope of $50M, banking ($2M avg. balance), and all statutory accounting ($128M sales). Created cash management processes to avoid currency losses.
- Advised 80-person Russian accounting organization to improve basic accounting processes and streamlined operations including opening on-site bank, developing operating procedures and direct system links with bank.

experiences.title: Operational & Finance Leadership - International
experiences.jobDescription:

- Delivered volume, sales and profit with NPV indexing 226 versus plan. Grew sales and volume indices 107 and 119 in the first 2 years respectively and maintained or grew market share in all key categories.
- Owned sales and marketing strategic planning. Achieved results through valued-driven commercials, close partnerships with distributions and retailers, and manufacturing partnership. 
- Drove operational excellence and built trust with the +75 person sales and marketing organization.  

•	As CFO; led strategic turn-around of P&G Ukraine, from $65M to $150M in sales and profits from $15M loss to $10M profit. 
- At the time, P&G Ukraine was a high potential growth market, following the ruble devaluation. Regrew business to become market leader.
- Led multi-functional, 40-person business team including finance, accounting, human resources, and supply chain planning. 
- Led customer and consumer strategy. 
- Developed cash management tools to drive breakeven cash stake (after a decade of in-country operations).
