With a deep understanding of the Network's mission to foster meaningful connections among Procter & Gamble alumni worldwide, Jeff is engaging with potential sponsors and cultivating mutually beneficial partnerships.
 
His strategic approach to sponsorship outreach involves a blend of insightful communication and a keen awareness of each sponsor's unique objectives. By tailoring sponsorship proposals to align with the interests and values of diverse businesses, Jeff has consistently garnered substantial support for the Global P&G Alumni Network's initiatives. His collaborative spirit and genuine passion for the organization's mission have resonated with sponsors, inspiring them to contribute to the Network's growth and impact.
 
Through his efforts, Jeff has not only secured vital financial support but has also helped elevate the Network's visibility and reputation within both corporate and alumni circles. His accomplishments stand as a testament to his exceptional abilities in relationship-building, negotiation, and strategic planning. Jeff Wuest's commitment to empowering the Global P&G Alumni Network through successful sponsorship endeavors has significantly contributed to its continued success in fostering a vibrant community of P&G alumni around the world."

Member Role and Responsibilities

As a member of Inc Masters, I share perspectives and insights on ways to grow and develop a business. It is an opportunity to not only share my insights with others but I learn a lot about growing my own company through these interactions.  I highly recommend Inc Masters program for anyone looking for a way to both share and improve their business acumen.

I would recommend Elena to any company looking for a strong leader to grow and develop their sales and marketing areas.

updates.postText:
🇮🇳 Once in a generation moment.

Walking out of the interaction with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the IndiaAI Mission with one clear feeling: this is real, and the responsibility is massive.

At Avataar, it reinforces why we’re building the UAI layer — a UPI-like interface for AI — open, scalable, and designed for real national impact.

Equally energizing to see the depth of founders building alongside us — BharatGen, Fractal, Gan.AI, Genloop, gnani.ai, IntelliHealth, Sarvam, Shodh AI, Soket AI Labs, Tech Mahindra, ZenteiQ.ai. The ecosystem feels ready.

To the Avataar team: Thanks for putting Gaurav Baid and me on this stage - moments like this don’t come often. 
Back to first principles. Back to building. Let’s earn this every single day.

Super excited to announce our $45mm Series B led by Tiger Global with co-participation from Sequoia India

Evan Feinberg - a hearty welcome on board the Avataar rocket ship. Your faith and confidence mean a lot to us. To let a secret out, we are already awe-inspired with the energy and clarity of thought you bring to the table, and eagerly look forward to our partnership!

Shailesh Lakhani - it’s been a true privilege to partner with you and thank you for the valuable mentorship. I’d likely run out of memory in an attempt to quantify your value-add. Thank you for your continued faith and mentorship, we wouldn’t be here without you, and looking forward! 

Prashanth Aluru Gaurav Baid Mayank Tiwari -  having co-founders of your acumen makes this journey so much more fun, passionate & enriching - love you guys, onwards and upwards!

Avataar - team, this milestone is a reflection of your efforts. Been proud and inspired to see the passion each one of you wears on your sleeves daily, and eagerly looking forward to the disruptive innovation that’s underway. Time to manifest our dream of being the shapers of our industry!

Full article link: https://lnkd.in/gqrPB3Re







#technology #venturecapital #future  #computervision #artificialintelligence

In an industry where standards are constantly evolving, establishing a foundation of quality and consistency is paramount.

Avataar’s selection as an Amazon-certified partner underscores the importance we place on delivering the highest quality of results for our partners.

This endorsement serves as both a validation of our expertise and a reminder of our commitment to innovation and measurable impact, which continues to drive the future of retail and e-commerce.

It’s not just about delivering solutions; it’s about consistently raising the bar and setting new benchmarks for excellence.

Thank you, Amazon, for being on this journey with us.

Grateful for the opportunity in today’s interaction with the Hon’ble Prime Minister Shri. Narendra Modi and fellow founders from the IndiaAI ecosystem.
What stood out was the clarity and consistency of the vision and direction provided. We got a chance to present an update on the Unified Artificial Intelligence layer (UAI) that we are building (UPI for AI).  

A few reflections I’m taking back with me:
- India’s real advantage in AI lies not just in innovation, but in large-scale, real-world implementation — moving beyond pilots to outcomes that touch everyday lives.
- The emphasis on AI for societal good reinforces the need to focus on harder, more consequential problems in agriculture, healthcare, education, skilling, and governance.
- Building AI that is accessible and easy to adopt will be as important as the sophistication of the models themselves — especially at India scale.
Indigenous data, local languages, and cultural context are not constraints; they are India’s strategic strengths.

At Avataar, this interaction strengthens our conviction to keep building AI systems that serve citizens, MSMEs, and public institutions, and to do so in a way that reflects India’s diversity and values.

Excited to collaborate with the broader IndiaAI community and translate this shared vision into tangible impact. 

Thanks to Hon'ble Ministers Shri. Ashwini Vaishnaw and Shri. Jitin Prasada, Secretary Shri. S Krishnan for giving this energy boost! 

Special call out to IndiaAI Mission CEO Shri. Abhishek Singh, Shri. Sudeep Srivastava and IndiaAI team.

🚀 Big News!

Avataar.ai is honored to be selected as a beneficiary under Phase-2 of the IndiaAI Mission to build an indigenous suite of domain-specific distilled AI models and Agentic orchestrations across functional contexts — with a focus on Task-Specialized Agentic Transformation and multi-modal use cases.
Our focus spans Healthcare, Agriculture, SMEs, and beyond — driving impact across some of India’s most critical sectors.

🙏 Under the leadership of Hon'ble Prime Minister Narendra Modi, this path is not just about technological capability, but about India setting global standards in how AI is built, deployed, trusted, and used for public good. A huge thank you to Hon'ble Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, Secretary S Krishnan, India AI Mission CEO Abhishek Singh, and Kavita Bhatia for their vision, wisdom and leadership, and the India AI Mission team for their passionate work. 

At Avataar, we are deeply motivated to contribute to this mission — shaping AI that is sovereign, inclusive, high-integrity, and reflective of India’s diversity.

🌍 Looking forward to showcasing progress and collaborating at the India AI Summit, February 2026 — onward with courage, collaboration, and impact!

#IndiaAI #AgenticAI #AvataarAI

headline: Business Development Lead at Bain & Company
about:
Current Senior Partnership Specialist supporting internal tools and external partnerships that specialize in Commercial Excellence / B2B by increasing their awareness and applicability to case teams.

Master's degree in Business Administration with a Bachelor of Science(s) in Economics and Market Research.

Additional Experience: 
•	High interaction with international clients across the globe.
•	Exceptional work ethic as exhibited through solid work history, volunteer positions, scholarships, honors, and recognition for academic performance. 
•	Proven ability to plan and execute research projects, interpret data and report on findings to clearly understand business performance, analyze opportunities and support sound management decisions.

experiences.title: Senior Commercial Excellence Partnership Specialist, Business Development
experiences.jobDescription:
- Develop tools, methods, processes and training materials in commercial excellence to deploy Alliance Partners’ unique capabilities into Bain case work and client & product solutions
- Create selling materials for internal and external client teams, including proposals
- Build and support pipeline management process, in collaboration with Bain practice teams and Alliance teams
- Manage logistics of internal and external marketing activities with select Alliance Partners
- Manage multiple projects under tight deadlines across multiple time zones/geographies
- Develop foundational awareness of all established players and emerging newcomers
- Create and deploy process to refresh and update ecosystem landscape POV on ongoing basis
- Support development of repeatable model to identify ecosystem current-state and future opportunities
- Codify new insights to enhance repeatable partnership playbook: knowledge capture and synthesis

experiences.title: Knowledge Management Specialist in Advanced Manufacturing & Services and Energy & Natural Resources
experiences.jobDescription:
- Coordinate and manage the capture and sharing of Bain’s Industrial Goods & Services knowledge and experience base into our global intranet platform. This includes the processing of case summaries, proposals, case examples, capability and product insights, tools and templates, as well as the meta-tagging of case information to facilitate user searching.
- Provide support to case teams in selling and serving situations.
- Support the Practice Area Director regarding Practice Strategy and Operations.
- Serve as a member of Bain’s global Product, Practice, and Knowledge team by contributing to global improvement projects, cross-practice collaboration, training, and mentoring.

experiences.title: Senior Project Manager (formerly Research Now)
experiences.jobDescription: Provide superior customer service while managing clients’ custom quantitative market research projects. Directly interact with clients, ensuring all projects are successful from start to finish. Maintain full project ownership in delivering complex custom market research projects with a project duration typically between 24 hours to 2 months. Build and grow effective, professional working relationships with clients, providing them guidance and advice as it relates to Research Now’s products and services. Manage multiple concurrent quantitative projects in a fast-paced environment with minimal error. Ensure project tasks are completed through personal production, internal support teams (such as survey programming, client development, etc.), and vendors (such as translators, etc.). Effectively communicate both as an individual and as part of a client-facing project team.

experiences.title: Market Research Project Manager (formerly Research Now)
experiences.jobDescription: Manage multiple projects at any given time, ranging from sample-driven to full service. Work closely with internal teams, as well as external sources, to ensure maximum customer satisfaction. Consistently exceed client expectations from project inception through completion. Proactively anticipate, troubleshoot, overcome, and/or escalate project challenges in a timely manner. Coordinate project task activities between project team, internal support teams, and external vendors. Set up and monitor reports to evaluate key project metrics, such as project profitability, and ensure quality measures are followed.

experiences.title: Research Analyst/Project Director (formerly Market Probe)
experiences.jobDescription: Served as Project Director while working throughout entire research process of delegated client projects. Coordinated internal project process and provided support for project management. Engaged in both quantitative and qualitative marketing research while using primary collection methods. Utilized phone, fax, web, IDI, focus group, and intercept interviewing/research. Gathered, tabulated, and analyzed data while following strict quality control. Submitted sample requests, run cross tabs, disposition, and frequency reports.  Developed tab plans, as well as programming notes, used for development and design of research programs used for the specific client projects. Prepared reports that were professionally delivered to clients.

experiences.title: Graduate Assistant
experiences.jobDescription: Provided comprehensive support and assistance in coordinating and facilitating curriculum for General Business Administration course 301. Served as a knowledgeable, accessible point of contact throughout the semester. Tracked and maintained student records and grades. Also assisted in the International Business Program while introducing study abroad and travel study opportunities to unfamiliar students. Served as a point of contact for potential interest and dealt with administrative work. Consistently accepted additional responsibilities to meet deadlines and address the ever-changing needs of faculty and students. Recommended solutions and proposed future teaching applications that were appreciated and implemented by the instructor.

experiences.title: Teaching Assistant
experiences.jobDescription: Provided comprehensive support and assistance in coordinating and facilitating curriculum for college-level courses in Macroeconomics, Microeconomics and Applied Econometrics. Served as a knowledgeable, accessible point of contact throughout the semester. Tracked and maintained student records and grades. Led individual tutoring sessions and group discussions.

recommendationsReceived.name: Colleen Vrbin Turcsanyi
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: President at Analytical Insights, LLC
recommendationsReceived.context: Colleen was Kelly's client
recommendationsReceived.description:
I'd like to provide an A+ recommendation for Kelly. Her attention to detail and dedication to quality are two of the qualities I appreciated most for the projects that we worked together on. When Kelly was the project manager for one of my studies, I knew that I was in good hands and didn't need to worry about the quality of the sample or the fit of the sample to the specs we needed. She was always on top of things. If a study would start to appear to field too quickly to skew to a certain demographic, Kelly was on it and would course correct as needed. 

In addition, Kelly was always a pleasure to interact with. I appreciate her positive demeanor.

recommendationsReceived.name: Annie Piasecki
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Audience and Message Research Manager at M+R
recommendationsReceived.context: Annie was Kelly's client
recommendationsReceived.description: I had the good fortunate of working with Kelly on myriad surveys during her time as a project manager at Research Now. As our surveys were in the field, Kelly did a fantastic job keeping us updated on our completes and quotas. She was always very responsive to our requests and offered us smart insights to help improve our questionnaires or the fielding process. Best of all, Kelly had THE BEST attitude, and her emails always exuded warmth, friendliness, enthusiasm and a willingness to help. I sincerely miss working with Kelly on a regular basis, but I know that wherever she goes, in whatever role she takes, she will leave clients happy and satisfied!

recommendationsReceived.name: Jill Rogers
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Senior Vice President - Market Research
recommendationsReceived.context: Jill was senior to Kelly but didn't manage Kelly directly
recommendationsReceived.description:
A Millennial that brings the best of several worlds to the job and whom you will love working with! 

Kelly is a hard-working, self-starter that knows how to get things done quickly, effectively and accurately. During projects, Kelly showed extraordinary resourcefulness and worked extremely well in a self-directed capacity. She embraced changing objectives and often functioned as an agent of continuing improvement, creatively enhancing the project process. 

On the interpersonal side, Kelly is a pleasure to work with. Despite the challenges that often arise unexpectedly in executing market research, Kelly always carried on with an upbeat and “can-do” attitude. Her sharp mind, business skills and outlook make her an asset in any situation.

recommendationsReceived.name: Jacob Jones
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Sr. Client Insights Manager
recommendationsReceived.context: Jacob managed Kelly directly
recommendationsReceived.description: Kelly is a client-first minded professional.  Her ability to juggle multiple projects while staying organized and focused is impressive considering her few years of experience.  Kelly is determined and isn't afraid to get her hands dirty or ask the tough questions.  She is an amazing asset, and any business team would greatly benefit from her ideas and contributions.  The sky is the limit for Kelly.

headline: MBA Candidate at Yale School of Management | Class of 2027 | Forté Fellow
about:
I am a project manager turned MBA candidate at Yale School of Management, with a passion for advanced manufacturing, automation, and the industrial sector.

I have led cross-border projects across the EV battery, automotive, and energy infrastructure sectors, working closely with SMEs in South Korea and global partners in the North America, Europe, Africa and Australia.

With hands-on experience spanning business development, technical sales, and project execution across industries, I thrive on the steep learning curves, dynamic project scope and strategic works. 

Post-MBA, I aim to pivot to consulting to gain a different business perspective and exposure to a wider variety of industries and functional areas.

experiences.title: Project Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
- Led end-to-end business development, consulting, and sales initiatives for industrial equipment manufacturers, including after-sales support and client relationship management.
- Spearheaded technical discussions, contract negotiations, and project delivery for cross-border & cross-continent initiatives in the EV battery, automotive, steel, oil & gas, and power generation sectors.
- Managed government-funded consulting projects that supported South Korean SMEs in expanding to North American and European markets, offering strategic guidance on market entry and positioning.

experiences.companyIndustry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
experiences.title: Supply Chain Operations Intern
experiences.jobDescription:
- Improved knowledge content to enhance slide deck utilization in client and executive meetings.
- Conducted research and analysis on third-party shipping data providers to strengthen freight rate modeling and internal forecasting.
- Led the redesign of the internal knowledge-sharing platform to improve onboarding efficiency and resource accessibility for new team members.
- Collaborated with the media team to extract internal data insights and develop external-facing content, including executive presentations, webinars, and news commentary.
